His previous loan helped him to buy farming supplies for his crops, which allowed him to support his family and pay for the household expenses. His goal is to build a house of his own so that he can provide better stability in life for his loved ones.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, pesticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Ms. Noreen is a 41-year-old, married woman. She is the mother of five children.

She is in the business of selling used clothes. Specifically, she buys a variety of old clothes from the main city market and re-sells them to the people of her local community. She started her business because it was very difficult for her to pay for her family's living expenses with the small amount of income generated by her husband. As a result, she decided to help her husband by earning money for the family, and now she plays a very important role in doing just that and supporting her family.

She has been associated with Kashf for the past four years. She is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 35,000 PKR, which will allow her to purchase a greater selection of clothes (in a larger variety of colors and sizes), and which in turn ought to satisfy her customer's demands. With the loan proceeds, Noreen expects to experience a boost in her net income through an increase in sales sales.

loans.use: to meet customer demand by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., a large variety clothing in different colors and sizes)

loans.name: Cesar Liborio

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 43 años de edad es casado vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar comunidad  Santa Rosa de Cerritos.

Cesar es integrante en la ventanilla VRC  de San Isidro se encuentra formado en la comunidad de Santa Rosa de Cerritos de una distancia de 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa son personas que se dedican a la  agricultura y crianza de los animales.

Cesar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de frejol y maíz también a la crianza de animales como el ganado. Solicita el crédito para la siembra de frejol y para la compra de bonos semillas y fertilizantes 

La compra lo realiza en la ciudad de Chillanes. El sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida. Los desafíos que se enfrenta es presencia de mucha lluvia. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear en el pueblo y las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Cesar is 43 years old and married. He lives with his wife and three children in the community of Santa Rosa de Cerritos in Chillanes, which is in Bolívar Province.

Cesar is a member of the San Isidro Communal Bank, which is in Santa Rosa de Cerritos, a community that is located 40 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The members engage in agriculture and raising animals.

Cesar is a farmer who grows beans and corn. He also raises animals, such as cattle. Cesar is requesting a loan so that he can plant beans by purchasing compost, seeds, and fertilizers. His purchases are conducted in the city of Chillanes. His dream is to improve his living conditions. The challenges he faces include dealing with the abundance of rain.

In his free time, Cesar enjoys walking through town and taking in the community festivals.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nazeera

texts.en:
Ms. Nazeera is 58-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have four daughters and two sons. Her husband is not in good physical shape, so he is unable to support their family.

She enjoys doing hand embroidery work, which she started doing with her daughters. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her area. Due to an increase in demand for her embroidery designs, she is hiring other women to help with her business. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life, including food, clothes, and education.

In order to meet the growing demand for her products, she needs to purchase additional materials. As a result, she is now requesting a loan in the amount of 35,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy more frames, needles, and threads of different colors. She hopes to have a good experience with this loan, which she expects will help her to generate more income.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional materials (e.g., frames, needles, and colored threads)

loans.name: Mónica María

texts.es: Mónica de  41 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos, Su esposo desde hace siete meses se suicido, dejándola sola y a cargo de la educación y el bienestar de su familia. Su esposo contaba con un negocio dedicado a la venta de bebidas y juegos de maquinitas, por lo cual Mónica decidió tomar el negocio y administrarlo para generar los recursos necesarios para e sostenimiento de su hogar.  Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de bebidas y la adecuación de las instalaciones locativas. Espera con esta inversión mejorar su calidad de vida y brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación..
texts.en:
Mónica, 41, is the mother of two children. Seven months ago, her husband committed suicide, leaving her alone with the responsibility of educating her children and providing for her family’s well-being. 

Mónica’s husband made a living selling drinks and providing a place to play slot machine games. She decided to continue operating his business in order to generate the necessary resources to support her household. Consequently she is requesting a loan to purchase drinks and to maintain the on-site slot machine games. She hopes this investment will improve her quality of life and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase drinks and to maintain on-site slot machine games.

loans.name: Rwebikona Abatatsigana Group

texts.en:
Schola is a widow, aged 25 years. She is from Rwebikona, a suburb in Mbarara municipality. She dropped out of school after senior four and got married at the age of 18. Her husband passed away in a car accident when he was 25, leaving her with three children and no source of income to support the family. She acquired a loan of UGX 800,000 and started up a food stall in the market, in order to survive and also to meet the needs of her children. This business grew and helped her to sustain her family, and also to support the education of her young sisters.

Schola's business progressed with the help of UGAFODE Microfinance loans, and this motivated her to mobilize her colleagues in the market to form a development group, called Rwebikona Abatatsigana. This group has helped to make their businesses to prosper, through linkages to customers. Now, they are requesting a new loan together, to help them increase their working capital, so as to improve their standards of living.

loans.use: To buy food items to resell

loans.name: Norman

texts.es: Norman es un joven emprendedor, muy trabajador y padre de dos niños, su ingreso es la única entrada de dinero en el hogar, por esta razón necesita comprar una motocicleta con la cual hará servicios de mensajería en varias empresas y en algunos restaurantes laborará en la entrega de comida express, Norman necesita un millón cuarenta mil colones (¢1.040.000) para comprar la motocicleta y realizar su propósito. Agrega que este financiamiento viene a hacer en su vida una solución a nivel personal y familiar
texts.en: Norman is an enterprising, very hard-working young man. He has two children and his earnings are the only source of income for his household. For that reason he needs to buy a motorcycle. With it he'll provide courier services for several companies and work in fast food delivery for a few restaurants. Norman needs 1,040,000 colones in order to purchase the motorcycle and accomplish his goal. He adds that this loan will provide solutions in his life, both for himself and for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica, de 43 años de edad, esta casada con Dante quien es empleado y el padre de sus 2 hijos de 13 y 8 años de edad respectivamente.  Vive en compañía de sus hijos y su pareja en su casa propia.La actividad que realiza  Mónica es la crianza y venta de pollos, para eso cuenta con un pequeño galpón instalado en la huerta de su casa con una capacidad para 250 pollos, luego cuando están grandes y listos los vende a los comerciantes de los mercados aunque ocasionalmente también los vende en su casa. Lleva en éste negocio cerca de 08 años y recibe el apoyo constante de sus hijos y su conyugue. Le gusta su negocio pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones tanto personales como económicas se siente muy bien porque con ello colabora en la eduación de sus hijos.Este es el cuarto crédito con Kiva, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, comprará  250 pollos para iniciar una nueva campaña de crianza y más alimento balanceado para su desarrollo y crecimiento adecuado.
texts.en:
43-year-old Mónica is married to Dante, who's in the workforce. He's the father of her two children aged 13 and 8 years. She lives with her children and her spouse in a house that she owns. Mónica's business is raising and selling chickens. For that she has a small coop set up in the vegetable garden located in her house with room for 250 chickens. When they're grown and ready she sells them to sellers at the markets, although she occasionally sells them from her home as well. She has been in this line of work for about 8 years, and she gets constant support from her children and her husband. She enjoys her business because it has brought her a great deal of satisfaction, both personally and financially. She feels very good, because this way she contributes to her children's education. This is her 4th loan with Kiva, and that's why she's thankful to the people who provide the loan she needs in order to accomplish her plans. On the other hand, she pledges to make her repayments in a timely fashion.
With the requested amout of 2000 nuevos soles she'll purchase 250 chickens so that she can start a new breeding cycle. She'll also purchase more balanced feed so the animals can develop and grow adequately.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and balanced feed.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 44-year-old, married woman. She is a mother of three children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. 

For the past two years, she has been doing a business of carpet manufacturing. She offers various handmade carpets, in different colors, and she has become famous in providing good quality carpets in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family.  She is also doing sewing as her part-time job. In this way, she is able to handle her family needs and requirements effectively. 

Yasmeen is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is satisfied with the support of Kashf Foundation and she has applied a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy good-quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She wishes to use part of the profits on her husband’s health.

loans.use: to buy good-quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es padre de tres hijos, todos estudiantes, vive con su familia en el pacífico sur, provincia de Puntarenas. Con esfuerzo propio logró levantar su casa pero no logró terminarla, aún debe concluir el muro de retención, el cuarto de pilas y otros detalles importantes, él está solicitando quinientos mil colones (¢500.000) para comprar materiales como cemento, piedra , arena , clavos y otros para terminar su vivienda. Es importante para él y su familia realizar estos trabajos lo antes posible, ya que la ápoca de lluvia ya inició en nuestro país y deben estar protegidos 
para el fuerte invierno que enfrentarán.
texts.en: Juan has three children, all of whom are students. He lives with his family in the South Pacific region, province of Puntarenas. Through his own efforts he succeeded in building his house, but he wasn't able to finish it. He still has to finish the retaining wall, the laundry room and other important details. He's requesting 500,000 colones in order to purchase supplies such as cement, rocks, sand, nails, etc. so that he can finish his house. It's important for him and his family to get this work done as soon as possible, since the rainy season has already started in their country and they need to be sheltered from the cold winter they will face.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Arkadik

texts.en:
Arkadik is 23 years old. He lives with his parents and is involved in agriculture. He keeps three cows, six lambs, 33 chickens, and 18 colonies of bees. Arkadik also owns agricultural land where he cultivates barley and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets.

Since Arkadik is the only breadwinner of the family, he would like to expand his agricultural business. He has requested this loan to purchase six little pigs, forage for feeding them, and seeds for cultivation. This will enlarge his business activity and he will gather more income, which is vital for sustaining his family.

loans.use: to purchase six little pigs, forage for feeding them, and seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio se dedica a la ganadería, él compra ganado para obtener crías y someterlas al proceso de engorde estabulado, una vez obtenido el peso ideal, lo vende en las ferias ganaderas locales, por esto necesita comprar frecuentemente ganado nuevo ya que la etapa de engorde toma varios meses, necesita un crédito por un millón de colones (¢1.000.000) con este dinero comprará terneros para continuar con su proyecto ganadero. Manifiesta su agradecimiento por la oportunidad de obtener crédito fácil y cómodo.
texts.en: José Antonio is a cattle rancher. He buys cattle to get calves and put them through the feedlot fattening process. Once they reach the ideal weight, he sells them in local cattle fairs. To do this, he needs to buy new cattle frequently since the fattening period takes several months. He needs a loan for a million colones (¢1.000.000). With this money, he will buy calves to continue with the cattle project. He says he is grateful for the opportunity to obtain this loan easily and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es:
Alexis se dedica al comercio minorista, tiene una tienda de abarrotes y  se esfuerza para brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes, ya que su interés es aumentar la clientela, él está solicitando un crédito or un millón de colones(¢ 1.000.000)
con este préstamo comprará un mayor volumen de mercadería y diversidad de productos de consumo diario.
Alexis nos manifestó lo feliz que se siente con este apoyo financiero ya que por otros medios le sería muy difícil tener acceso a un crédito.
texts.en:
Alexis is a retailer. He has a convenience store and he works to offer his customers a good service, because he wants to increase his clientele. HE is asking for a loan of one million colones (¢ 1.000.000). With this loan, he will buy a larger quantity of merchandise and different products for daily consumption. 

Alexis told us he is happy with this financial support since by other methods it would be very difficult to have access to credit.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his convenience store.

loans.name: Santos Francisco

texts.es: Don Santos de 41 años de edad vive con su esposa y su hijo de 13 años se dedica a la reparacion de todo tipo de electrodomesticos como televisores, equipos de sonidos, licuadoras, etc, con el trabajo que realiza ha logrado salir adelante con su familia, Don Santos solicita un credito que le ayude a comprar todo lo que ocupa para hacer su trabajo como: repuestos para televisores, para licuadoras, y una variedad de accesorios para su trabajo ya que con lo que cuenta no le alcanza para poder comprar nuevas cosas y asi el podra seguirle dando a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Santos is 41 years old. He lives with his wife and 13 year old son. He repairs all kinds of appliances, such as televisions, stereos, blenders, etc. With the work he does he has been able to get ahead with his family. Santos is asking for a loan to help him buy everything he uses to do his job, such as: replacement parts for televisions and blenders, as well as a variety of accessories for his work. What he has isn't enough to buy new things and this way he can give his family more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for appliances.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 66 years old, married, and a mother of three children. For the last ten years, she has earned a living by selling farm produce in Mpeketoni, Lamu. She earns a monthly profit of KES 12,000. 

Dorcas was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer and she is applying for her fifth loan of KES 20,000 to buy seeds, some fertilizer, and other farm inputs needed for her business. 

She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her grandchildren as well as to expand her farming activities. Her goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view of increasing her income, so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy seeds, some fertilizer, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and has three children, of whom only one goes to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has a business of selling fish, a business that she has been in for some time. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more baskets of fish to resell.

She works from her home, and she works seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of fish. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to build rental housing. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish.

loans.name: Aunier

texts.es: Aunier es un comerciante con mucha experiencia, él se ha dedicado  a la actividad de venta de alimentos, actualmente se le está presentando la oportunidad de adquirir la franquicia de un negocio de venta de batidos (bebidas a base de frutas)el cual ha sido bastante aceptado por la comunidad, el local, el equipo y el menaje que le ofrecen es según nos comenta Aunier una excelente oferta, para aprovechar dicha oportunidad con la cual el considera que le ayudará a superarse económicamente necesita un crédito por un millón cuarenta mil colones (¢1.040.000). Agradece la facilidad de financiamiento que se le brinda a través del crédito comunal.
texts.en: Aunier is a very experienced merchant.  He has been engaged in food sales and currently he has been presented with the opportunity to acquire a business franchise selling smoothies (fruit shakes), which has been popular in the community. The location, the work team and the kitchen equipment offered with the franchise are an excellent deal according to Aunier.  He would like to take advantage of the opportunity, that will help him overcome his economic necessities, which will require a loan of a million forty thousand Costa Rican Colones (CRC1,040,000) [about $2100 USD].  He is thankful for the financing offered through this community loan.

loans.use: to purchase a Smoothies Franchise (fruit shakes)

loans.name: Gilber

texts.es: Gilber es un joven agricultor de 25 años de edad, vive con sus padres en la zona sur del país,  él está solicitando un préstamo de seiscientos mil colones (¢600.000) para la compra de semilla de frijol, abono granular y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos durante el desarrollo , El vende la cosecha en el centro de acopio de su  localidad y de esta manera ayuda a sus padres, cubre los gastos de sus estudios y hace frente a otras obligaciones económicas, desea llegar a ser un productor grande según manifiesta y  para ello realiza su mejor esfuerzo en esta actividad .
texts.en:
Gilber is a 25 year old young man, and he is a farmer.  He lives with his parents in an area in the southern part of the country.

He is requesting a loan for six hundred thousand colones (¢600.000) in order to buy bean seeds, granular fertilizer, and fungicides to protect his crops while they are growing  

He sells his harvest at the local gathering center.  This way he helps his parents, covers his educational expenses, and meets his other financial obligations.  

He indicates that he would like to become a big producer.  In order to do so he puts his best effort into this business activity.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Shakili

texts.en:
Shakili lives with her niece. She is raising her niece as her own child. Her niece is her entire family.

Shakili is a dressmaker with 12 years of experience, and this is the main source of the family's income. In addition, to provide meat and dairy products for family consumption, she keeps livestock in the yard of her house. She is planning to acquire additional cattle in the future, and then she will start selling dairy products. This is why she has applied for a loan -- for the construction of stalls for the animals. Her need for this construction is 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: To have stalls constructed for her animals

loans.name: Sallu G.o.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, to request a loan of 13,500,000 SLL for the entire group, in order to meet their most urgent and pressing financial challenges. And at the end of each month, they can repay, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Sallu is the featured leader of this team. He is a native of Mabuya village, in northern Sierra Leone. Sallu is age 45, he is married to another teacher, and the couple has six children who are attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. Sallu has been a school teacher for 27 years. He has requested this loan, in order to pay school and college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school and college fees for his six children

loans.name: Zubida

texts.en:
For the past 30 years, Ms Zubida, a 57-year-old mother of four children, has been buying and selling animals. She buys baby goats and baby cows at low prices, raising them until her husband sells them in the market at higher prices.

Zubida has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation and is now requesting a loan of Rs. 50,000 to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is 28 years old and a mother of three children. She has been selling used clothes for a period of about two years, earning an income of approximately 5,000 KES a month. This is her second loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous one. She wants to use the loan to buy more used clothes to sell. She hopes to have another outlet at Mlolongo Centre, one day.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms Razia is a 39-year-old, married woman and mother of four children. She is successfully running a food stall in her community, with her husband. They work selling fruit chat/salads in a stall located at the corner of a popular street in their town. She is helping her husband, by contributing to the family income through all her hard work.

Razia has been in association with Kashf Foundation for eight years. Currently, she has requested a loan of PKR 50,000. She will use the loan to purchase sacks of apples and guavas, with tins of pineapple. She is hoping to get a boost in their net income, and she aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples and guavas, with tins of pineapple.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 63 años de edad, esta casada con Cayo quien es cocinero y junto a el tuvo un hijo que ya es mayor edad , actualmente solo vive con su esposo en su casa propia.La actividad que realiza Rosa es la venta de comidas como desayunos, almuerzos y otros. Estableció su negocio en un amplio espacio de su casa. Atiende principalmente por las noches, pero en ocasiones lo hace también por las mañanas. Sus clientes son transeúntes de la zona, vecinos y amistades,  por fortuna su establecimiento tiene buena acogida gracias a la buena sazón de sus comidas. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 06 años, emprendió esta aventura con ayuda de su esposo gracias a un crédito financiero que obtuvieron, ahora trabajan juntos atendiendo siempre de manera cordial.Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual solventar los gastos de su hogar, pues ha tenido muchas necesidades económicas por los bajos ingresos que obtenia cuando su esposo trabajaba como cocinero en un restaurante particular, pero ahora se siente más aliviada por desarrollar en su propia casa un oficio que le sirve de mucho.Este es el crédito número 06 con Kiva, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo.Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles comprará de víveres e ingredientes para la preparación de comidas y realizará algunas reparaciones en su local como el arreglo de pisos y paredes, además adquirirá más sillas y mesas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 63, is married to Cayo who is a cook and she and he had a son who is now an adult.  She currently lives just with her husband in their own house.  The activity Rosa carries out is selling food like breakfasts, lunches and others.  She started her business in a spacious part of her house.  She mainly works in the evening but sometimes also mornings.  Her customers are passersby in the area, neighbors and friends.  Fortunately, her establishment is well-received thanks to her tasty cooking.  She’s been in business about six years.  She started this venture with support from her husband and thanks to a loan they got.  Now, they work together providing cordial customer service.

She likes that her business makes it possible for her to earn income to cover her household expenses because she’s had many economic needs due to the low income she used to get when her husband worked as a cook in a private restaurant.  But now she feels more relief because doing her work in her own house is very useful for her.

This is her sixth Kiva loan and she’s grateful to all those who make it possible for her to access financing because this way she feels more certain about making progress at work.  She will use the requested 1,000 new soles to buy foodstuffs and ingredients to make her dishes and will also do some improvements to her site like repairing the floor and walls; she will also acquire more tables and chairs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and to repair her site.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 37 años de edad, esta casada con Richard quien es empleado y  padre de sus 3 hijos de 17, 16 y 14 años de edad respectivamente.  Vive en compañía de su pareja e hijos en su casa propia.La actividad que realiza Isabel, es la venta de zapatps de damas y caballeros,  para lo cual realiza viajes periódicos cada mes a otra ciudad, donde realiza sus compras buscando los mejores precios y modelos, para luego venderlos entre sus amistades de manera personal. Realizando estos negocios desde hace más de 06 años desempeñándose sola, en la busca de nuevos clientes y la venta de sus productos.Le gusta su negocio pues le genera los ingresos económicos necesarios para solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de su hija, así puede apoyar a su pareja para sacar adelante juntos a su familia.Antes tenia problemas económicos, pues los ingresos de su pareja no le alcanzaba para cubrir todos sus gastos familiares. Actualmente tiene los deseos de ampliar su negocio y hacerlo crecer, abriendo tienda de ropa en su hogar.Este es el crédito número 05 con Kiva, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le brinde la garantía para continuar trabajando con mucha tranquilidad.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará zapatos de diversos modelos y tallas buscando los precios más bajos para que pueda tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Isabel, 37, is married to Richard who is employed and is the father of their three children who are 17, 16 and 14 years of age respectively.  She lives in company of her spouse and children in her own house.  The activity Isabel carries out is selling women’s and men’s shoes.  To do so, she makes trips periodically every month to another city where she makes her purchases seeking the best prices and styles to then sell them personally among her acquaintances.  She’s been doing this business alone for about six years always looking for new customers to sell her wares to.

She likes her business because it generates income needed to cover her household expenses and to pay for her daughter’s education.  In this way, she can help out her spouse so that they can support the family together.

She used to have economic problems because her spouse’s income was insufficient to cover all the family expenses.  She now wants to expand the business to make it grow by opening a home-based clothing store.

This is Kiva loan #5 and she’s very happy to know that she has financial support that will guarantee her being able to stay in business working with peace of mind.  She will use the requested 1,500 new soles to buy shoes in various styles and sizes seeking the lowest prices so her profits will be higher.

loans.use: to buy shoes in assorted styles and sizes.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en:
Ms. Sahib had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband and to support her family for a better future. 

Twenty-five years ago, Sahib began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers.  

Sahib is currently in her second loan cycle and has borrowed Rs. 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including cloth, thread in different colors, and packs of buttons and needles. This will create a means of increasing revenues, so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth, thread in different colors, and packs of buttons and needles.

loans.name: Rev.sheku B.

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Rev. Sheku, a teacher at one of the vocational institutions in Makeni city. The 57-year-old was born in the village of Rokupr. He is married to a nurse, and the couple has three children – two in secondary school and one in college. Rev. Sheku has been a teacher for 21 years. He has requested this loan, in order to buy building materials for the construction of a dwelling house, like corrugated iron sheets, sand, nails, and cement. 

School teachers, like Rev. Sheku, do normally come to SMT, to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can easily meet their most immediate and most pressing financial challenges. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan. It is normally their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

loans.use: to buy building materials, like corrugated iron sheets, sand, nails, and cement, for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Claudia Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Claudia de 30 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hijo se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa casual para hombres y mujeres, ropa deportiva, etc. tiene su negocio desde hace 1 año en su lugar de residencia y tiene mucha clientela pues vende a buen precio, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su esposo logra cubrir los gastos que tiene en su hogar, Doña Claudia esta solicitando un credito que le permita poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir con mas y mejores estilos de ropa para satisfacer al cliente y ella podra obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor establilidad economica.
texts.en:
Claudia, 30, lives with her husband and son; she works selling all types of casual clothing for men and women, sportswear, etc.  She’s had her business at home for a year and has many customers because she sells at good prices.  She uses profits generated from her sales to help her husband cover household expenses.  

Claudia is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to stock up with more and better clothing styles to meet customer demand so she can earn higher profits that will help her have improved economic stability.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es: don victor de 49 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus 8 hijos; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace mucho tiempo, el comercia en todos los alrededores de donde reside y se ha hecho de mucha clientela adicional a su trabajo de agricultor tambien tiene una crianza de ganado que le ayuda a complementar los gastos del hogar, ha decidido a aumentar la producción en sus tierras pero necesita de apoyo de capital para la compra de insumos por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, fertilizante, herbicida etc. y asi el podra darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Víctor, 49, lives with his life’s companion and their 8 children.  He has been working growing corn and beans for a long time.  He sells them in areas surrounding where he lives and has attained a large clientele.  In addition to his agricultural work he also raises cattle that help him cover household expenses.  He’s decided to increase his land’s productivity but needs capital support to buy supplies which is why he’s requested a loan to buy corn and bean seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, etc. in order to be able to provide his family with a fulfilled life.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Bernardino Antonio

texts.es: Don bernardino es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra principales granos básicos maíz y frijol. bernardino desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros asi como muestra en la fotografia. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Bernardino’s a man who is very responsible with his household obligations.  He currently lives with his wife and four children.  He’s very hardworking; he’s always worked with joy and enthusiasm.  He works in agriculture growing mainly basic grains like corn and beans.

Bernardino wants to increase his sales which is why he’s requesting a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and pesticide, among others, as shown in the photograph.  He wants to be able to count on the requested support because he has no other source of income.  In this way he will continue to provide his home with daily bread with no limitations.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Jaime Alfonso

texts.es: Don Jaime es un cliente casado, tiene tres hijos siendo el mayor de quince años, todos estudian y cubre sus necesidades con su  trabajo como cadete de taxi, labor muy cansada y peligrosa ya que se tiene que transitar por algunas zonas con alto índice delincuencial, pero lo tiene que hacer porque no tiene otra opción de ingresos, su esposa no trabaja, se encarga del orden del hogar. Este crédito que solicita don Jaime es para el mejoramiento de las paredes del servicio sanitario que son de plástico y el piso del cuarto de su vivienda para estar en mejores condiciones humanas en lo que cabe dentro de sus posibilidades.
texts.en: Jaime is married and has three children. The eldest of his children is 15 years old and all of them attend school. He covers his needs through his work as a taxi driver. It's very tiresome and dangerous work, since he has to drive through some areas that have a high crime rate. However, he has to do it, since he has no other source of income. His wife doesn't work and she's in charge of housekeeping. The loan that Jaime requests is for improving the bathroom walls which are made of plastic and the floor of the bedroom in his house. That way he'll improve his living conditions as much as he can within his means.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, iron and bricks.

loans.name: Reverien

texts.en:
Reverien is a 26-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. 

Reverien started selling lights in November 2012, and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening and then sell them.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is a 30-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. 

Jean Baptiste started selling lights in November 2012, and he has sold 30 lights to date, providing clean energy to 150 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife, Irene, and their two children.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Ms. Shagufta is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She has been successfully running a small beauty parlor in her community for the last ten years.  She is a good beautician and has good communication skills. 

Shagufta is a self-made woman and wants to increase her business. Her husband is employed with a low income, which is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members alone. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently, she needs a loan of Rs 35,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time, which ultimately will help in generating more income.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Sahibzadi

texts.en:
Sahibzadi is a 56-years-old married woman. She is the mother of 8 children and living in joint family system. Her husband works for daily wages in a sugar mill. She has run a business of animal sales and purchasing for the last three years. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation.

Currently she requests a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase one cow. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase one cow.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 25 years old and married to Faith, who contributes to the family income. He has been running his mobile money transfer outlet for a period of about two years, with an income of about KES 10,000 a month.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD, and he will use the entire loan amount to buy phones and phone accessories. He hopes to grow his business, open more outlets and give his children a quality education up to university level.

loans.use: to buy phones and phone accessories.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 5 enfants, Fatoumata est âgée de 45 ans, et vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux et leurs enfants dans le quartier koko de la préfecture de Koutiala (région de Sikasso). 
Pour des raisons sociales, Fatoumata n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études, pour cela elle s’est basée sur les activités génératrices de revenus depuis le bas âge. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par se lancer dans l’achat-vente du bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois  il y’a plusieurs années.  
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle en quantité, augmenter la taille de son activité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a 3 ans. Elle est à son 6ème  prêt individuel dont les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter  3 chargements de remorques dont 2 en bois de chauffe et 1 chargement charbon de bois dans les villages environnants de la ville de Koutiala. Elle effectue sa vente devant sa porte à une clientèle  de femmes et d’hommes  au comptant et  à crédit.  
Elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour  le remboursement des intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et investir le reste dans d’autres activités génératrices de revenus. 
Elle compte sur les financements  de Soro  Yiriwaso pour l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of five, Fatoumata is 45 years old and lives in a polygamous family with her husband in children in the Koko district of Koutiala prefecture (Sikasso Region). For social reasons, Fatoumata did not have an opportunity to receive an education, which is why she started earning a living from an early age on. After having tried various business activities without success, some years ago she ended up launching a business buying and reselling firewood and charcoal. In order to satisfy the volume of customer demand and expand the business, three years ago she decided to reach out to the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. She is on her 6th individual loan, and the prior loans have been duly repaid. With this lad, she plans to buy three loads of firewood and one load of charcoal in villages near the town of Koutiala. She sells in front of her home to a customer base composed of both men and women, for cash and on credit.

She plans to achieve an average monthly revenue of 100,000 West African francs, which she plans to use to pay off Soro Yiriwaso’s interest, help provide for everyday household needs, and reinvest the rest in other business projects. She counts on Soro Yiriwaso financing in order to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood and charcoal.

loans.name: Reeta

texts.en:
Reeta is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She started her business with the support of Kashf Foundation and is happy to earn a reasonable income to contribute in the family income. 

To make her store fully stocked, she needs to purchase rice, flour and sugar so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000. In this way she will be able to cater to more customers. She is expecting to boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose is a single mother of and has been blessed with two children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

For the past year, she has operated a petrol and fuel selling business, selling to motorcycle operators. In addition she also does farming which earns her additional income. She cites the high cost of transportation to be her major challenge. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase 50 litres of petrol and diesel for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 50 litres of petrol and diesel for resale.

loans.name: Claver

texts.en: Claver is a 64-year-old man from Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Claver started selling lights in February 2012 and he has sold 60 lights to date, providing clean energy to 300 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife and grandchildren.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude  is a 43-year-old man from Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Jean Claude started selling lights in February 2012 and he has sold 40 lights to date, providing clean energy to 200 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife and children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Yusila

texts.en:
Yusila lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has four children and has been doing this work for 12 years. Her primary income sources are from milk, eggs and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable is "dairy farming". Her biggest challenge is drought. She  will use the loan of 60,000 KES to buy insecticides for her crops.

Yusila was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Because of farming'.  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Cultivating a savings culture.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Yusila replied "ease payment of fees".

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Yusila owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power' but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy insecticides

loans.name: Parvana

texts.en:
Parvana is a widow, 45 years old and has one son. Her son works abroad, he is engaged in selling fruit & vegetables in Russia. 
Parvana sells women's clothing and dowry goods. She has done this for more than 22 years. She earns income to sustain the household and to help her son to marry when he is back home. She loves her son and the dream of her life is to see her grandchildren.   

She needs this loan to buy women's clothing and dowry goods. This will allow her to increase her inventory and income, and improve the quality of her merchandise. Her objective is to optimize her business, attracting new customers and increasing her income.

loans.use: To purchase women's clothing and dowry goods.

loans.name: Kadziche

texts.en:
Kadziche is a married woman and has six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Kadziche operates a goat meat business, buying and fattening them for resale to butchers. She faces a challenge of inadequate capital to expand her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.


With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase five goats for meat sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase five goats for meat sale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 36 years old and married to Beatrice who contributes to the family income. He has been running his wholesale shop for a period of two years with an income of KES 16,000 a month.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one. He will use the loan to add more stock of Coca Cola soft drinks for distribution. He hopes to open other distribution points and invest more in order to give support to his family.

loans.use: to add more stock of Coca Cola products to sell

loans.name: Qarash

texts.en:
Qarash is a 43-year-old married man. He has one son and one daughter. His wife is a housekeeper.  He has a car shop where he repairs different parts of automobiles. He is a master in this field because he can fix all kinds of problems related to engines and he has 10 years of experience in this field. His monthly profit is 400 AZN

He needs additional funds to invest in new equipment for his shop. In his city, everybody has a car and of course, people need a good master for their car. Now he needs a 2,000-AZN loan .This new loan will help him to increase the efficiency of his garage. He will be able to repair larger size cars.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for his car repair business

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda lives in the Syuniq region with her husband and two sons. Seda works at the local village hall as an accountant. As there is a high unemployment rate in the region, Seda's salary is hardly enough to cover her family's basic costs. Seda, together with her husband and sons, is also involved in agriculture. They keep 2 cows, 3 calves, 11 lambs and 20 chickens. They also cultivate wheat. The whole family works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it in the local market. But, having no financial means for covering transportation costs, it is very difficult for Seda's son to take the harvest to the market and sell it. 

Seda has requested this loan to purchase a cow and cover fuel costs. The loan is very important for the whole family to be able to expand their agricultural activity and gather more income.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and fuel costs

loans.name: Mary Mwihaki

texts.en:
Mary is 54 years old and married with children who are between 15 years and 7 years old.

Mary used her previous loan well and was able to buy seeds and fertilizers, which enabled her to get a good harvest. She has applied for her fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable her to start a transport business that will be her secondary business.

She hopes to secure a bigger loan in the future that will enable her to improve her dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Benoitte

texts.en:
Benoitte is a 58-year-old woman from Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. 

Benoitte started selling lights in February 2012 and she has sold 40 lights to date, providing clean energy to 200 people. She is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself, her husband and her grandchildren.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Tula

texts.es: Tula, de 44 años de edad, vive en compañía de su pareja, sus cuñados, su suegros y su menor hijo de 09 años de edad respectivamente.El trabajo de Tula consiste en la venta al por menor de productos de primera necesidad, entre los que se encuentran; arroz, azúcar, leche, panes, huevos, aceite, verduras y mas. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa en donde atiende todos los días y a tiempo completo. Lleva trabajando por  06 años en este rubro. Complementa este negocio con la venta de zapatos para damas y le va muy bien.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para cumplir otras actividades eventuales, afortunadamente le va muy bien ya que siempre tienen clientes debido a la variedad de productos que ofrece y porque además en la única bodega en su localidad, espera poder seguir surgiendo y hacer crecer su negocio.Este es el préstamo número 04 con Kiva, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante.Con el monto solicitado de S/.2500 soles, comprará mercadería para su tienda conformada por golosinas, arroz, azúcar, panes, huevos, leche, aceites. Verduras entre otros.
texts.en: Tula is 44 years old and lives with her husband, her brother in law, parents-in-law, and her 9-year old son. Tula's work consists in selling convenience store items, among which are: rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, vegetables, and more. She has this business in her house and works every day, full-time. She complements this business with the selling of shoes for women and it is going very well for her. What she likes about her job is that she has time to complete other activities, fortunately it is going very well for her since she always has clients because of the variety of products that she offers. She is the only store in her area, and she hopes to continue getting ahead and grow her business. This is her fourth loan with Kiva, and she is very thankful for the opportunities that it will bring, and for the financial backing that she needs to get ahead. With the 2500 soles that she is asking for, she will purchase merchandise for her store such as: candy, rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, oil, and vegetables, among other things.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store such as: snacks, rice, and sugar, among other things

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, Esther has operated a business selling fruits and vegetables from home. She faces a challenge of seasonality in fruits. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers’ needs.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase fruits, green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing goods

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en: Dzame comes to you again for another loan of KSHS 15,000 to help her boost her business. She again appreciates your previous help and currently she is planning to use the loan to buy more wheat flour, beans, maize flour, onions and tomatoes for preparing food for her clients.

loans.use: to buy more wheat flour, beans, maize flour, onions and tomatoes for preparing food for her clients.

loans.name: Zhasmen

texts.en:
Zhasmen is from Ujanis village where she lives with her husband. To be financially secure and ensure a stable income for herself and her husband, an accountant by profession, she started this farming business six years ago. Currently, Zhasmen keeps three cows and two calves. She milks cows and gets dairy products, which her husband sells in the local open markets. Realizing that selling the dairy products is profitable enough to cover the family's basic costs, Zhasmen would like to expand it 
.
She has requested this loan to purchase a cow and a calf. This will enable her to gather more milk and milk products, the sales of which will significantly improve her income. The loan is very important for Zhasmen to enlarge her agricultural business and improve her family's life.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and a calf

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 25 years old and married to Hellen who also contributes to the family income. They have one child who is two years old. He has been selling eggs for about four years, earning approximately 4,000 KES each month.

This is his second loan with KADET LTD and he wants to use it to buy bulk supplies of eggs for resale. He hopes to improve the living standard of his family and be happy.

loans.use: To buy eggs in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Fausttin

texts.en: Fausttin is a 46-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Fausttin started selling lights in July 2012 and he has sold 50 lights to date, providing clean energy to 250 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife and children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Eufemioano

texts.es: Don eufemiano de 62 años se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado, su principal siembra es el maiz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista las va almacenando en los graneros que muestra en la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarlos en las agencias de granos basicos que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive con su esposa y su hijos, Don eufemiano esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos agricolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en: Don Eufemiano, who is 62 years old, has worked in agriculture for many years. His principle crops are corn and beans. When his harvest is ready, it is stored in the granaries that are shown in the photograph so that he can later sell them to grain companies that are close to his home. With the money he obtains from his sales, he helps with his family's expenditures. He lives with his wife and children. Don Eufemiano is asking for a loan in order to purchase agricultural inputs that will help with his crops, such as fertilizer and seeds, so he will be able to make more money and continue helping his family with their expenses without limitation.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs such as fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Grey Alicia

texts.es:
24238
Grey tiene 42 años de edad es casada vive con su esposo  y sus cuatro hijos en Chillanes  Provincia de Bolívar  recinto pacas.

Grey se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de babaco.

 Solicita el crédito para los insumos que es necesario para su cultivo de babaco como el abono. 

  La compra lo realiza en la ciudad de Chillanes  comercial flores.

 El sueño es mejorar el incremento del cultivo de babaco.

 El desafío que se enfrenta es ser competitivo en el mercado con productos buenos. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar  indor y básquet.
texts.en: Grey is 42 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their four children in Chillanes in the province of Bolivar, in the Pacas precinct. She works cultivating babaco. She is asking for the credit for the inputs necessary for the cultivation of babaco, such as fertilizer. She will make the purchase in the Flores center in the city of Chillanes. Her dream is to increase the amount of babaco that she cultivates. The biggest challenge that she faces is to be competitive in the market with good products. In her free time, she likes to play indoor soccer and basketball.

loans.use: to purchase inputs that are necessary for the cultivation of babaco, such as fertilizer

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, known for the high production of milk and grains for the coutry's population. He has two children and has been doing this work for eight years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming is 'harvesting'.  His biggest challenges are occasional droughts and financial sourcing. He will use the loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy insecticides for his horticultural farms. 

Paul was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied 'Efficiency.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Farming as a business.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?' Paul replied 'Help pay school fees.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Paul owns the following: 'a cow, poultry, and a bicycle' but does not own 'a pig, a pump, a motorcycle, or an automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household  'a mosquito net and solar power' but does not have 'electricity, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy insecticides

loans.name: Ayisa

texts.en: Ayisa is married with one child who attends school. She has had a beauty salon business for six years.  She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids and hair oils.  She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity.  She works in a rented shop six days out of every week. Her major business challenges includes paying high taxes and 'on and off' electricity.  She aspires to own a bridal salon and also to get enough profits so as to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.   Her monthly expenses include rent and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids and hair oils.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is a married business man who offers taxi service within Mombasa town, Kenya. He has been running the business for four years. He was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenyan shillings to pay for insurance coverage.

The challenge in this business has been the fluctuating business seasons, given that it is tourist related and tourists come during certain periods of the year. Even so, he believes there will be enough income to repay the loan and meet his basic needs.

loans.use: To pay for insurance coverage.

loans.name: Georgina Natalia

texts.es: Doña Georgina se dedica a la comercializacion de paletas y sorbetes en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela pues es un producto que se vende con mucha facilidad con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con su familia vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar mas productos y asi obtener mas ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Mrs. Georgina has worked selling sweets and ice cream out of her house for many years. She has many customers, so it is a product that she sells very easily. With the money she makes, she wants to get ahead with her family. She lives with her spouse and their two children. She is asking for a loan that will allow her to purchase more products and therefore obtain a greater income and give her family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy products such as sweets and ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 30 years old and married to Wachira who also contributes to the family income. They have two children aged eight and one years old. She has been selling refilled gas cylinders and cosmetics for a period of about five years with an income of approximately  KES 25,000 a month.

She is taking her second loan in KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one. She wants to use the loan to buy more refilled gas cylinders to sell. 

She hopes to expand her business and increase the income they get in order to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy more refilled gas cylinders to sell

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik is from Verashen village where she lives with her husband, son and daughter. Arevik and her family have been involved in agriculture for more than 16 years. They own agricultural land where they cultivate tomatoes and also grow peach, apricot, cherry, plum, and apple trees. Arevik grows trees with great love and care, which is why the family is able to gather a good harvest and sell it in the local market.

As the only income of the family comes from selling the agricultural products, it is very important for Arevik to expand her agricultural activities. Arevik owns a greenhouse which is too old and needs to be renovated. She has requested this loan in order to renovate the greenhouse, and to purchase tomato seeds for cultivation.

The loan is very important for Arevik and her family, enabling them to enlarge their farming business and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse and tomato seeds for cultivation

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ivania, 33 años de edad, originaria de Estelí, acompañada, madre de 3 hijos, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de fritanga y frescos.
Sus comienzos fueron muy difíciles porque comenzó a vender sus fritanga y frescos debajo de una sombrilla pequeña en la calle, ya que ella necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir y generar ingresos por si sola, pero luego miro que su negocio necesitaba mas capital, fue así que decidió buscar financiamiento para poder comprar  sillas, mesas, con el objetivo de ofrecerles un ambiente cómodo y familiar a sus clientes.
Ella esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar gaseosas maíz, aceite, pollo por mayor, queso, etc, con el propósito de ofrecer variedad de comida a sus clientes, ya que de esta manera podrá obtener mejores ingresos, una de su  meta próxima es poder comprar toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de su comida, unos de sus planes futuro es poder dar empleo a  otras personas.
texts.en:
Ivania is 33 years old. She is originally from Estelí, is married, and is a mother of three children. She works selling fried food and soft drinks. Her start was very difficult because she began by selling her products under a small umbrella in the street, since she needed a way to sustain herself and generate an income. Later, she saw that her business needed more capital, and it was then that she decided to look for financing to purchase chairs and tables with the objective of offering a comfortable and familiar environment to her clients.
She is asking for a loan to purchase soft drinks, corn, oil, wholesale chicken, cheese, etc, with the goal of offering food to her customers, since in this way she will be able to obtain a better income. One of her immediate goals is to purchase all of the materials she needs for a wider variety of foods, and one of her future plans is to employ other people.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, corn, oil, chicken, and cheese for her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell in her community.

loans.name: Sonia Maria

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 36 años de edad es casada vive con su madre  y sus tres hijos Chillanes  Provincia Bolívar  comunidad Alungoto.

Sonia se dedica a la crianza  de animales como los cerdos.

 Solicita el crédito para aumentar  las compras de animales.  

 La compra lo realiza en la ciudad de Chillanes semanal  mente. 

El sueño es tener su casa propia.   

El desafío que se enfrenta es mal tiempo.

  En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar las  plantas.
texts.en: Sonia is 36 years old, married, and lives with her mother and her three children in Chillanes, in the province of Bolivar, in the community of Alungoto. She works raising animals such as pigs. She is asking for a loan to increase her purchase of animals, which she will do monthly in the city of Chillanes. Her dream is to have her own house. Her biggest challenge is bad weather. In her free time, she likes to take care of her plants.

loans.use: to increase the purchase of animals.

loans.name: Rwebinyansi Kwetungura Newer Group

texts.en: Eldard is a resident of Bukanga village in Isingiro district. He is 39 years old. He dropped out of school after primary seven because his parents could not afford to pay tuition for secondary education. He then resorted to supporting his parents in banana farming, which was his father’s main source of survival. At the age of 17, he got married and his father gave him a small piece of land, which he used to plant his own plantain and this enabled him and his family to survive.  He later obtained a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from Ugafode, which he used to buy another piece of land to expand his plantation. This has helped him to prosper, which motivated him to mobilize men and women in his village to form a development group called Rwebinyasi Kwetungura Group. This group has helped them to succeed in farming and it is requesting a loan to help them buy manure for their plantations and caricides for their crops.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is grateful for having received a number of loans through Milango. The business is doing well and was able to raise required repayments for the previous loan. 

Margret has decided not to take out a larger loan because of the low season, but would like to purchase a few items on demand. She is therefore applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy basins and cups to sell, as these items are in demand in the area.

loans.use: To buy basins and cups for sale.

loans.name: Raquel Noemi

texts.es: Doña raquel vive con su esposo y sus hijas en casa propia se dedica a la comercializacion de telas, retazos, waiper,etc. cuando compra los rollos de telas los va embolsando asi como muestra la fotografia, para luego comercializarlos su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo ha podido salir adelante con su familia, Raquel esta solictando un credito que le permita poder comprar rollos de tela para despues elaborar los retazoz y los waipers y asi obtener mejores ganancias y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Mrs. Raquel lives with her husband and their children in their own house. She works selling fabric, remnants, fabric scraps, etc. When she purchase rolls of fabric, she embroiders them as though they depicted photographs, so that she can later sell them. Her business is located in her house. With the money that she makes and the help of her husband, she has been able to get ahead with her family. Raquel is asking for a loan that will allow her to purchase rolls of fabric so that she can later make the fragments and obtain a better income and be able to give her family better economic stability

loans.use: To buy rolls of fabric for her business

loans.name: Nyiro

texts.en:
Nyiro is a married man with eight school-going kids. He lives at his own house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the last four years, he has operated a goat meat selling business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators in his business.

With the KES 30,000 loan, he wants to purchase more goats for his meat sales business to earn a living and support his children. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for sale of meat to earn a living and support his children.

loans.name: Guranda

texts.en:
Guranda is 34 years old. She lives in Batumi District with her husband, two children and her mother-in-law. Her mother-in-law receives a retirement pension. Guranda has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is a car wash, which is rented out. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Guranda requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Guranda has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit Guranda will open a beauty salon in her house, which is located in the center of Batumi. She will purchase all the necessary equipment for the salon. This will be an additional and stable source of income for the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a beauty salon

loans.name: Leda Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Leda, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo e hijos, ella labora como mesera en una restaurante privado en la capital y su esposo es conductor en una empresa privada entre los dos se ayudan con los gastos del hogar y sobretod con los gastos de sus hijos como el colegio, ella sueña con terminar su casa y poder tener mejores condicones en el hogar, su preocupacion en estos momentos es la seguridad de su casa ya que la zona en la que habita es un tanto peligrosa y necesita construir un muro en la parte de enfrente de la casa para mayor seguridad, con este nuevo credito comprara: Piedras, Cemento, Arena, Hierro.  para construir, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic le ha brindado en estos ultimos años.
texts.en:
Leda lives in the city of Ticuantepe with her husband and children.  She works as a waitress in a restaurant in the capital while her busband is a driver for a company.  Between the two of them, they contribute towards the household expenses.  

More than anything, they support their children (for example, by paying for their education).  She dreams of finishing her house and being able to have better living conditions.  She worries about the safety of her house, since the area where she lives is somewhat dangerous.  She needs to build a wall towards the front of her house in order to make it more secure.

With this new loan, she will buy gravel, cement, sand, and iron to help with construction.  She is grateful to Afodenic for the support they have given her these last few years.

loans.use: buy construction materials.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, de 56 años de edad, originaria de la Comarca Filemon Rivera, en las afueras de Estelí, soltera, madre de 3 hijos, mayores de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de nacatamales, de la que es propietaria hace mas de 3 años.
Ella inicio en el ámbito del comercio hace 2 años, con capital propio, dinero que tenia ahorrado, ya que ella necesitaba un medio del  cual subsistir  y sacar adelante a su familia, fue asi que decidió vender nacatamales, ella se siente muy  orgullosa porque en su negocio le va muy bien, ya que  le genera ganancias a diario, este ha sido su primer negocio, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.
Rosa esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar  maíz, arroz, leña, carne, etc. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus nacatamales, con el propósito de incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias, dentro de sus planes futro es poder mejorar la infraestructura del local en donde tiene su negocio, para ofrecerles un ambiente cómodo y familiar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa, who is 56 years old, is originally from Comarca Filemon Rivera, on the outskirts of Estelí. She is single, the mother of three children who are grown. She works selling nacatamales (corn, meat, and rice wrapped in banana leaves), which she has done for more than 2 years.
She started her own business 2 years ago, with her own money that she had saved, since she needed a way to subsist and get ahead with her family.  It is then that she started to sell nacatamels. She felt very proud because her business has been very good, since she generates an income every day. This has been her first business, and she counts of the support of her family.
Rosa is asking for a loan to purchase rice, corn, firewood, meat, etc. She estimates that this loan will allow her to purchase all of the materials she needs to make her nacatamales, with the goal of increasing her sales and obtaining a greater income. Among her future plans is to be able to improve the infrastructure of her place of business, in order to offer customers a more comfortable and familiar environment.

loans.use: to purchase corn, rice, firewood, and meat to make food to sell.

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doris, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de más capital de trabajo en el negocio de ventas de panes, hamburguesas y otros. Este le permitirá comprar refrescos, soda, panes, carnes, entre otros para ofrecerles un mejor servicio a los clientes.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio y con las ganancias ha logrado aportar para la familia. Las condiciones de vida han mejorado, ya que le ha brindado ayuda a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Doris is asking for a new loan because she needs more working capital for her business of selling bread, hamburgers, and other things. This will allow her to purchase soft drinks, bread, and meat, among other things, in order to offer better service to her customers.
