The previous loan helped get her business on solid footing, and with the money that she has made, she has been able to provide for her family. Her living conditions have improved, since she has been able to support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bread, meat, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Janeth Marisol

texts.es: Doña Janeth de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo de 19 años. Ella posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que ella realiza es excelente y los elabora a precios realmente accesibles; élla es una mujer muy dedicado a su trabajo responsable y honesto, Janeth esta solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, y todo lo relacionado con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y asi ella y su hijo podran tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Janeth is 40 years old and lives in her own house with her 19-year-old son.  She has a sewing shop where she lives where she makes different kinds of clothes.  Recently, she has obtained a large number of customers because the work that she does is excellent and she offers her goods at reasonable prices.

She is a very dedicated woman and is responsible and honest.

Janeth is asking for a loan which will allow her to buy fabric, thread, needles, and everything she needs for sewing.  In this way, she can continue satisfying the needs of her customers and obtain a better quality of life for herself and her son.

loans.use: buy sewing supplies (thread, needles, fabric, etc).

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Doña Maria de 48 años de edad tiene un negocio de carniceria desde hace 14 años esta ubicado en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues es una mujer muy amable con sus clientes y vende carne de muy buena calidad con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante con su familia, vive en casa propia con sus esposo y sus dos hijos, Doña Maria esta solictando un credito que le permita comprar mas carne y materiales para elaborar lo chorizos para poder satisfacer siempre a su clientela con buenos productos y poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia lo necesario sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old and has had a butcher shop for 14 years.  It is located in the market that is close to where she lives.  She has many customers because she is very friendly with them and sells very high quality meat.  With the income that she makes and the help of her husband, they are able to help their family progress.  She lives in her own house with her husband and their two children.

Maria is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy more meat and supplies to make chorizo.  In this way, she will always be able to satisfy her customers with good products and will be able to make better profits.  She hopes to be able to give her family all that they need, without any limits.

loans.use: buy merchandise such as meat and chorizo (spicy sausage).

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is married with two children, and one of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has business running a pub, and she has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of beer, soda, boxes of mineral water and jerrycans of local gin.  

Milly works seven days out of every week in a shop that she rents. Her major business challenges include defaulters, thieves and seasonality. She aspires to own a fully stocked pub and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer, soda, boxes of mineral water and jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Don Manuel de 51 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus hijos en un rancho que cuidan, trabaja de apodar grama de forma ambulante o que el cliente lo haya solicitado por medio de una cita, tiene mucha clientela que lo busca pues su trabajo lo realiza muy bien; con las ganancias que el obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar pero no le alcanza para poder comprar los materiales que utiliza,  por eso solicita un credito que le permita comprar todo lo necesario para su trabajo y poder mejorar su apodadora que muestra en la fotografia para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Manuel is 51 years old and lives with his wife and their children on a farm that they maintain.  He works mowing lawns, traveling to find work or serving customers that ask for his help beforehand.  He has many customers that seek him out because the work that he does is very good.  

With the profits that he makes from his work he is able to cover the household expenses but it isn't quite enough to allow him get the materials that he uses.  For this reason, he is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy all that he needs for his work and also allow him to improve his lawn mover (which is shown in the picture).  In this way, he will be able to make more profits and give his family better financial security.

loans.use: buy supplies for mowing lawns.

loans.name: Kanipu

texts.en: Kanipu is grateful for the support she is receiving through Milango. Her business is on the rise and has a few items that are in demand. She has recently used her extra income to pay for school fees and is therefore asking for a loan of 10,650 Kenyan shillings to buy new stock of cereals for sale. She is riding on the current demand to meet the repayments of this and the previous outstanding loan.

loans.use: to buy new stock of cereals for sale.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es: Martha, es una joven que trabaja para una institución estatal, vive con su pareja, ambos tienen una bebe de 4 meses de nacida y ha visto la necesidad de acondicionar mejor su cuarto el cual no presta las condiciones necesarias para compartir los tres y no cuenta con los recurso para realizar esta obra, por esta razón solicita el crédito para ampliar un poco mas su cuarto y tener mayor comodidad.
texts.en: Martha is a young woman who works for a government institution. She lives with her partner and their four-month-old daughter. She has to prepare their bedroom for the baby because it is not set up to accommodate the three of them, but she does not have the resources to complete the project. She is therefore requesting a loan to expand the bedroom and make it more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, rebar, and cement blocks.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan , tiene 33 años de edad , esta casado con Teofila. Posee una vivienda construida  a base de  bloques de adobe donde vive con sus 2 hijos.Desde hace 13 años se dedica a la producción integral de cacao orgánico en la localidad de Palma Pampa, gracias al fruto de su trabajo ha logrado salir adelante desempeñando su labor con el apoyo de jornaleros que contrata para las actividades mas complicadas como el deshierbo .Le agrada su trabajo puesto que disfruta de su estancia en el campo mientras realiza sus actividades cotidianas con el apoyo de su familia.Como parte del inició correspondiente a la campaña cacaotera proyectada para el presente año desea contar con capital para realizar su trabajo de manera fluida, puesto que la época de lluvias esta a punto de culminar y  es necesario también contar con abono orgánico que es utilizada con la lluvia y aporta considerablemente  en los resultados.Tiene como meta a futuro la construccion de su vivienda con material noble.
Desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico esperando así obtener una producción de calidad.
texts.en: Juan is 33 years old and married to Teofila. He has a house made of adobe bricks, where he lives with his two children. He has been growing organic cacao for 13 years in the village of Palma Pampa. He has been quite successful and has worked hard, sometimes hiring day laborers to help him with more complicated tasks such as weeding. He likes his work because he enjoys spending time in the fields as he carries out his daily activities with his family's support. As this year's cacao-growing season is beginning, he would like to have more capital to be able to carry out his work, as the rainy season will end soon and he needs to purchase organic compost that is used at this time and significantly improves crop yields. In the future he hopes to rebuild his house using better materials. He needs 3,000 nuevos soles to buy the organic compost and ensure a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy organic compost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Don mario de 51 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años su principal siembra es chile, pepino, tomates, comercializa sus cultivos con los comerciantes que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos de su hogar vive con su esposa y su hijo, Don mario esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos agricolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y tambien para darle una mejora a su terreno que muestra en la fotografia y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en:
Mario is 51 years old and has been working in farming for 15 years.  His main crops are chiles, cucumbers, and tomatoes.  He sells his crops to shopkeepers that are near where he lives.  With the profits that he obtains from his sales, he helps with the household expenses.  He lives with his wife and their son.

Mario is asking for this loan to be able to buy farming supplies that will help him to plant his crops, including manure and fertilizer.  In addition, he wishes to improve his land (which is shown in the picture).  In this way, he will be able to make better profits and continue helping with the household expenses.
.

loans.use: buy farming supplies such as manure, fertilizer, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Haydee

texts.es: Gloria de 40 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hijo de 14 años, ella tiene un negocio de salon de belleza desde hace 8 años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Gloria solicita un credito para poder comprar productos para su salon de belleza como: cremas, shampoos, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y asi podra obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Gloria is 40 years old and lives with her husband and 14-year-old son.  She has been running a beauty parlor where she lives for 8 years.  She works from 9:00 am to 7:00 pm and has many customers because she works very hard.  With the profits that she makes and with the help of her husband they are able to cover the household expenses.

Gloria is asking for a loan to be able to buy supplies for her beauty parlor such as creams, shampoo, hair clips, scissors, and other things that she needs.  In this way, she will be able to obtain better profits and help her family have greater financial stability.

loans.use: buy supplies for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with six children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

Susan has a beauty salon and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, cosmetics and hair conditioners. She works from her home and works seven days out of every week. She sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and on-and-off electricity. She hopes to own a fully stocked beauty salon and also to build rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more hair treatments, weaves, braids and boxes of cream relaxers.

loans.name: Maria Carmelina

texts.es: Doña Maria de 53 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en casa propia, se dedica a la venta de pan frances en un parque que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela, tiene 13 años de realizar ese trabajo y con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo han logrado cubrir los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella solicita un credito para poder comprar mas pan frances y asi obtener mejores ganancias y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Maria is 53 years old. She and her husband live in their own home with their four children. She sells bread in a park near their home. She has a lot of customers. She has had her business for 13 years, and with her earnings and her husband's help has been able to cover the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more bread and increase her income so she can offer her family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy bread to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: redoing the finishing on the interior of their bathroom.

loans.name: Hilda Amelia

texts.es: Doña Hilda de 40 años de edad vive con sus 3 hijos dos de ellos estudian actualmente y el otro trabaja en una carpinteria viven en casa propia, trabaja de elaborar piñatas para fiestas de cumpleaños desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con las ventas que realiza ha logrado cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Doña Hilda solicita un credito que le eprmita comprar mas materiales como: papeles de todo tipo de colores, pegamento, alambre, papel de diario entre otras cosas que le sirven para la elaboracion y asi podra obtener mejores ganancias y podra seguirle dando a sus hijos lo que necesitan sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Hilda is 40 years old and lives with her 3 children, two of whom are currently in school whereas the other works as a carpenter and has his own house.  She has worked making piñatas for birthday parties for several years.  Her business is located in her house.  With the sales that she makes, she has been able to cover the household expenses.

Hilda is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy more supplies such as paper of all colors, glue, wire, newspaper, and other things that help her to make piñatas.  In this way, she will be able to obtain better profits and continue giving her children what they need, without any limitation.

loans.use: buy supplies to make piñatas.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is grateful and states that he is glad to have joined Milango. He is currently repaying another loan. He has observed some demand for a few items in the business, but he does not have the money to stock them. He is, therefore, asking for a loan of 5,650 Kenya shillings (KES), which he will use to buy a new stock of mobile phone chargers to resell at his shop. He hopes to catch on the demand and make a good sale.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone chargers, to resell at his phone repair and accessories shop.

loans.name: Mwamure

texts.en:
Mwamure lives in Tiribe, Kenya. He is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He has been operating a meat goat business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces the major challenges of stiff competition and the high cost of goats. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop, in the future. 

He has requested a loan of KES 30,000. He will use it to purchase more goats, for production of meat to sell to his customers. He joined Yehu because of its responsiveness to customer needs.

loans.use: to purchase more goats, for production of meat to sell to his customers

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is 61 years old. He lives in the village of Dzirula, Zestaponi District, with his 52-year-old wife; three children; daughter-in-law; and two grandchildren, 7 and 5 years old. Tamaz has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times to start-up a family business but without any success. His loan requests are rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The main source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. They have a milk cow and pigs. The cow is milked every day to make cheese and from the pigs they get piglets. The family also owns a vineyard and they make vodka. All the products and piglets are sold locally at the markets. In addition, Tamaz has a truck and he is working on private orders to transport different cargo to earn a small monthly income.

Tamaz requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Tamaz has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Tamaz will purchase pottery and wooden wares from the wholesalers at a low cost. He already has a commercial space in the center of a local market which he will use as a shop. The products will be sold with a price markup from his shop and Tamaz will earn additional income for his family. He will reinvest part of the profit in the same business and use another part for his family's well-being. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase pottery and wooden wares from the wholesalers

loans.name: Brehima

texts.fr:
Monsieur Brehima est âgé de 41 ans et vit avec sa femme et ses  6 enfants dans la ville de Koutiala. 
Brehima a prématurément abandonné l’école pour s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis son enfance auprès de ses frères. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, il opta finalement pour  l’achat-vente de poissons fumés il y’a 13 ans.  Pour  pouvoir augmenter son fonds de commerce et renforcer sa capacité de vente, il décida de rejoindre  l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 4 ans. Il est à son 6ème prêt individuel dont les précédents ont été bien remboursés. Il compte acheter 10 paniers de poissons fumés  à Korientzé  (Région de Mopti) auprès des  pêcheurs d’ethnie  Bozo et Somonô et effectue sa vente au marché à poisson de Koutiala  à une clientèle constituée  de femmes et d’ hommes,  au comptant et quelques fois à crédit. 
Avec ce financement il compte  réaliser un profit de 100.000FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera pour  le remboursement des intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire les besoins  de sa  famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Brehima is 41 years old and he lives with his wife and his six children in the city of Koutiala.

He left school very early and, at a young age, he became interested in income-generating activities, which he learned from his brothers.  After being involved in several unsuccessful activities, he finally decided to buy and sell smoked fish 13 years ago.  He decided to join Soro Yiriwaso four years ago to increase his business and boost his sales capacity.  He has duly repaid five previous loans and is now taking his sixth individual loan. 

Brehima is planning to buy 10 baskets of smoked fish in Korientzé (Mopti region) from Bozo and Somonô fishermen [Bozo and Somonô people are ethnic groups predominantly located along the Niger river in Mali].  He sells his merchandise at the Koutiala fish market, for cash and sometimes on credit, to both men and women.

Thanks to this loan, he is expecting to make a monthly profit of 100,000 CFA francs, which will be used to pay off Soro Yiriwaso's interest and to meet the needs of his family. The rest of the money will be reinvested into his business.

loans.use: to buy some smoked fish.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is grateful to all the lenders for the previous loans she has received. Her business is running well, and she was able to meet the previous repayments required. She was also able to educate her children from the loan.

Maureen had planted and received a bumper harvest. She is therefore applying for a loan of 41,850 KES, which she will use to pay for the transportation of the farm produce from the farm to the market, for sale. She hopes to make a good sale from the produce and repay the loan.

loans.use: To pay for the transportation of farm produce, from the farm to the market.

loans.name: Vicentia's Group

texts.en:
Vicentia is one of the members of Vicentia's Group. Her group is located in Dansoman. It is comprised of two entrepreneurs from one of the poorest communities of this large city, each of them dedicated to running a small business from her house, and by making walking sales.

Vincentia is 52 years old and has two adult children, who are working on their own. She is excited to be taking her sixth loan from ID-Ghana. She plans to use her share of this loan to invest in her business. She sells Tilapia fish. She runs this business in front of her house, close to the roadside. She says that her most difficult business challenge is her inability to buy enough fish for her customers. Vicentia, together with Elizabeth, needs to borrow a total amount of GHS 1,900. Vicentia will use her share to buy enough fish to sell to her customers. She will use her profits to save and to reinvest in her business.

She enjoys watching television, and she dreams of having her own house in the near future, so that she can stop paying rent.

loans.use: To buy enough fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 25 years old and lives in a small village called Vanashen in one of the southern regions of Armenia, Ararat. He lives with his wife, mother and little daughter. 
Karen works at a local company and earns a monthly income which is hardly enough to cover the family's basic expenses. 
To be financially secure, Karen, an economist by profession, runs a farm. His farm currently includes ten chickens. He grows tomatoes, peaches, apricots, cherries, plums and apples.
Karen works hard to reap a good harvest and cover the family's expenses. He has applied for this loan to pay for fertilizer and hire employees to start planting. The loan is very important for Karen to be able to increase his income.
He dreams of having a big farm and ensuring a better life for his daughter and future children.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and employees for planting season.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr: Mme Fanta vit à Lomé, au Togo. Elle est mariée à un commerçant  et ils ont trois enfants. Depuis 2000, Mme Fanta exerce comme activité la vente de boubou, bazins  à domicile et de façon ambulante. Normalement, elle achète ses produits à vendre à Bamako au Mali. Elle a demandé un prêt à WAGES  pour renforcer son activité. Elle espère améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille et ouvrir une boutique.
texts.en:
Fanta lives in Lomé, Togo.  She is married to a retailer with whom she has three children.  

Since 2000, Fanta has been selling "boubous" and fabrics (damask), from her home and door-to-door.  She usually buys her merchandise in Bamako, Mali.  

She has requested a loan from WAGES in order to boost her business.  She would like to improve her family's standard of living and to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy damask fabrics and "boubous".

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a married mother of three, school-going children. She lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She runs a poultry business and a charcoal retail business, which have been in operation for five years.

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 42,650 Kenya shillings (KES). She will use the loan to buy a new stock of charcoal and chicks, to sell. She believes the additional income from this loan will improve the living standard of her family.

Her ambition is to own three poultry sheds, despite the challenge of occasional low business seasons.

loans.use: To buy a new stock of charcoal and chicks, to sell

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is 40 years old. She lives in the Batumi district with her mother, brother, sister-in-law and an infant nephew. Irine has requested a loan for her family business start-up from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Irine’s brother works as an artisan and her sister-in-law works at a local restaurant as a waitress. They both earn a small monthly income. It is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo's estimates, the family belongs in the subsistence poor category. 

Irine requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing business start-ups credit with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With this credit Irine will purchase a car. After purchasing a car, she will be able to supply her newly opened restaurant with supplies. Irine has chosen a very good place in the centre of Batumi, where a large number of people live. She hopes the business will be profitable. The new business initiative, financed with a Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and use it to supply her restaurant.

loans.name: Robnison

texts.en:
Robinson is an employee with Vision Group where he works as a photographer. He is a widower; his wife died last year of cancer. Robinson spent most of his savings trying to save her life though she didn’t make it in the end. 

Robinson is applying for two million shillings to pay tuition for his daughter at the university. He hopes he will easily pay the loan installment and also have his daughter study comfortably. He thanks Ugafode for the swift and relevant services offered to clients.

loans.use: To pay tuition.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is grateful for the previous loan he received through Milango. He managed to repay the loan on time and also pay for most of his family's needs.
He would like to increase the operations of his farm. Stephen is therefore applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy new poultry-keeping equipment like water and feeding troughs. He looks forward to a great business season and states that he plans to set up other poultry sheds.

loans.use: To buy new poultry-keeping equipment like water and feeding troughs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Assia

texts.en:
Assia is a recurring clients who is coming to Yehu Microfinance for another loan. She says thanks for the previous loan as she was able to expand her business and increase her monthly profits.

With this loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business in the future and earning more profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Habet

texts.en:
Habet is a 23-year-old farmer from the Shirak region. He lives with his parents and, together with them, is involved in agriculture.

Habet runs a farm which currently includes 18 cows, 20 calves and 56 lambs. He also owns agricultural land where he cultivates wheat and potatoes. Habet's mother milks cows and makes dairy products that Habet and his father sell in the local market.

As the main source of the family's income comes from the farming business, Habet would like to expand it. He has requested this loan to purchase 10 little pigs and five calves and to renovate the old barn. The loan is very important for Habet to increase his livestock and renovate the barn, which is too old.

Habet hopes that the loan will help him to increase his income, and he will be able to continue the expansion of his farm.

loans.use: to pay for 10 little pigs, five calves and renovation of the barn.

loans.name: Genadi

texts.en:
Genadi is 53 years old. He lives in the Batumi city with his 46-year-old wife, Rusudan, and two children, who are students. Genadi requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Genadi has a car-washing service. Along with washing the cars from the outside, they also wash carpets and get a small monthly income. Rusudan is working as a lecturer at the local university and she is also working part-time at the local children's clinic as a nurse. The total family income is rarely enough to cover their expenses. 

Genadi requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Genadi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Genadi will purchase a vacuum cleaner and also make an advertising banner for his washing service center. With the vacuum cleaner, Genadi will be able to offer better service to his customers and wash the cars not only from outside, but also clean them from inside. With the poster, he will be able to attract more clients, and this will significantly increase his income. Increased income will help Genadi to cover the family monthly expenses and also provide for his children's studies.

loans.use: To purchase a vacuum cleaner and also make an advertising banner for his car-washing service center.

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Tumaini is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. She runs a pub that has been in operation for the last seven years. She is also married and has three school-going children. Tumaini would like to increase the sources of income for her family.
She is therefore applying for a loan of 74,450 Kenya shillings to purchase a motorcycle which she will let out for use in the transportation of goods and people within the area.
She looks forward to a great business season and hopes to improve the living standard of her family through the extra income from this new venture.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Ramadhan

texts.en:
Ramadhan is a married man of three school-going children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Ramadhan has operated a retail shop business for two years. He sells household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour to neighbors. He faces a challenge of delayed payments by creditors in his business. Ramadhan dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan of 50,000 KES, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ildelfonso Eliseo

texts.es: Don ildelfonso de 65 años de edad vive con su esposa en casa propia; el posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicado en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocido por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, el quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que tendra una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Idelfonso is 65 years old. He lives with his wife in the house that they own. He has a shop where he sells household staples, beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other products. He has had this business for many years, and it has given him sales experience that allows him to earn better profits. His shop is located in his residence, and it is very well-known among his neighbors in the area. He has built a large clientele, as he keeps the shop stocked. 

Idelfonso wants to grow the business and make a new investment, but he needs capital. That's the reason he has requested this loan, which will allow him to buy what he needs for his shop. He is sure that he will pay off the debt, and at the same time, he trusts that he will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married woman who has four children who all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a food stall business, selling from her home to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments. In the future, she dreams of expanding to a café business. 

With the loan of 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is 22 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past two years, Agness has been working hard to manage her salon where she does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Agness has requested a loan of 200000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hair extensions and hair dryers for the salon, and will help Agness to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Agness hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Agness is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more hair extensions and hair dryers for the salon,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Mavis's Group

texts.en:
This is a group of two women from a city in the coastal part of Ghana. They have come to ID-Ghana, a partner of Kiva to apply for a loan of GHS 1,700 for the team in order to support their businesses. They sell fabric, wigs, creams and shampoo. Every week they go to the meeting to make a payment on their loan.

Mavis sells fabric. She is 30 years old and a native of Dansoman. Mavis is single and has no children. She has requested this loan in order to buy more fabric to supply both tailors and seamstresses in her locality.

loans.use: To buy more materials.

loans.name: María Delmi

texts.es: María de 43 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de tortillas en el lugar de su residencia, es muy conocida en la localidad, María es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella solicita un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, leña, cal, gas propano, etc. María tiene la esperanza que así podrá regalarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old. She lives with her life partner and their children in the house that they own. She has a tortilla shop in her residence. She is well known in her town, and she is a very hardworking woman.

María is requesting a loan to allow her to purchase wholesale corn, firewood, lime, propane gas, etc. María has hope that this will enable her to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for making tortillas.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: jose de 33 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones, vive con su familia, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y frijol con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de sus cosechas ayuda en los gasto de su casa, jose desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso a solicitado un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, entre otras cosas, y asi porder seguir teneiendo buenas ganacias para ayudar en su hogar.
texts.en:
jose is 33 years old. He is a man who is very responsible with his obligations. He lives with his family and he works as a farmer, growing corn and beans. With the profits he earns from the sale of his harvests, he helps with household expenses. 

Jose would like to increase his sales, and so he has requested a loan that will allow him to buy seeds and fertilizer, among other things. That way, he will be able to continue to have good earnings to contribute to his home.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen's group is comprised of four hardworking women. Hellen is 21 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past two years, Hellen has been working hard to manage her restaurant where she sells convenience foods. 

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal for the restaurant, and will help Hellen to generate greater profits so that she can take care of her child and her family. Hellen hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build a residential house for herself. 

Hellen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal for the restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Don Francisco, trabaja vendiendo de manera ambulante, se ayuda junto a su esposa quien le apoya en vender los productos de cosméticos, el viaja a diferentes departamentos del país para ofrecer sus productos y lograr hacer unas ventas, siendo su único medio de ingreso que le ayuda a mantener su hogar y los gastos de colegio de sus hijos quienes dependen de él. Solicita crédito para invertir en su pequeño negocio ya que carece de productos suficientes para comercializar.
texts.en: Francisco works as a traveling salesman. He is helped by his wife, who supports him in selling cosmetics. He travels to different departments of the country to offer his products and make some sales, as this business is the only source of income that helps him maintain his home and cover the school expenses of his children, who depend on him. He is requesting a loan to invest in his small business, as he lacks sufficient products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther is single and 37 years old. She could not attend high school after her junior high school certificate, and she has one child. She sells provisions such as milk, Milo and rice. She set up this business on a table top and now has five years of experience. She has been able to erect a small store close to her residence.

Esther organized these ladies, and their group is requesting a total loan amount of GHS 2,650. The loan will be used to buy sugar, salad oil, rice, beans, eggs, and women's clothing. 

In the near future, Esther wishes to open a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, milk and Milo and sell to customers.

loans.name: Gloria Arminda

texts.es: Doña gloria de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, Ella posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que ella realiza es excelente y los elabora a precios realmente accesibles; élla es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo y responsable, gloria esta solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, y todo lo relacionado con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y asi ella y su esposo podran tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gloria is 57 years old and lives in her own home with her husband.  She has a sewing workshop in her home where she make different items of clothing.  Lately she has gained many new customers because she does excellent work at affordable prices.  Gloria is very dedicated and responsible with her work.  She is applying for a loan that will allow her to buy material, threads, needles and other dressmaking items so as to continue fulfilling her customers needs.  With this work, Gloria and her husband will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy threads, material and needles for dressmaking.

loans.name: Neftali De Jesus

texts.es: don neftali de 55 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 25 años y eso le ha dado la experiencia para asistir sus cultivos su principal siembra es el maiz y el sorgo, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos basicos que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, el esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos agricolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y tambien para darle una mejora a su terreno para tener una mejor cosecha y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en: Neftali is 55 years old and has been working in agriculture for 25 years.  This work has given him experience in looking after his crops.  Neftali mainly grows corn and sorghum and sells his products in to local agencies that buy and sell basic grains.  With his profits, Neftali helps with family costs.  He lives in his own house with his wife and two children. Heftali is applying for a loan so that he can buy farming supplies that will help with sowing crops, such as manure, seeds and fertliser.  This will also help improve the land and produce a better yield, and thus a better income to continue supporting with household costs.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Olga Margarita

texts.es: olga de 29 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia y sus 2 hijos ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal como lociones, cremas, shampoos, desodorantes, entre otras cosas,con las ventas que realiza cubre algunos gastos de su hogar, tiene mucha clientela ya que los productos que ella vende son de muy buena calidad por eso solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar mas mercaderia para surtir su negocio y tener mas ganancias para seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesitan
texts.en: Olga is 29 years old and lives in her own house with her family and two children.  Olga makes a living selling personal products such as lotions, creams, shampoos and deodorant.  With her sales, Olga is able to cover some of her household costs.  She has many customers as she sells very high quality products.  Because of this she is applying for a loan to buy more merchandise to stock up her business and have high profits so that she can continue to give her family what they need.

loans.use: to buy products (perfumes, creams and more).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of smoked fish

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 33 years old and married with four children.  With four children in school, Jenny works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, soap, shampoo, milk and coffee. Jenny has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.
In the future Jenny would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, soap, shampoo, milk and coffee.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie works hard to support her family. Annie is married and has a cafeteria business in the Philippines.

Annie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business such as milk, sugar and coffee. Annie has been in this business for five years now. In the future, Annie would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business such as milk, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Enrique Roberto Eduardo

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 63 años y vive en la ciudad de Ica al lado de su esposa con quien tiene 2 hijos a quienes quiere muchísimo y por quienes trabaja muy duro para poder brindarles una vida digna y sobre todo mucho amor. Desde joven Roberto tuvo la necesidad de trabajar para poder apoyar a sus padres, por ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar ingeniería mecánica.

Día a día Roberto trabaja como chofer de taxi, el recorre las calles de la ciudad en busca de clientes y también trabaja como agricultor, ya que tiene una parcela y en ella siembra productos de pan llevar, con lo cual tiene un ingreso extra; él cree que está saliendo adelante porque es trabajador y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Roberto está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá realizar la preparación de su parcela agrícola como arado, abono y sembrío de pallares, y abono de pécanos, de esta manera el podrá sembrar sus productos y poder obtener una mejor cosecha y así mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera el podrá seguir trabajando y esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Comprar un terreno y tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Roberto is 63 years old and lives in the city of Ica, along with his wife. They have two children together who he loves very much and for whom he works very hard, in order to be able to offer them a dignified life and above all, love. Since he was young, Roberto has needed to work in order to support his parents. For this reason, he was only able to study until the fifth grade of secondary school, but he would have liked to study mechanical engineering.

Day in and day out, Roberto works as a taxi driver. He drives the streets of the city in search of customers and he also works as a farmer. He has a parcel of land where he grows staple products for extra income. He thinks he is doing well because he is hard working and has a great desire to get ahead.

Roberto is very grateful to Kiva borrowers because thanks to the help they have offered him, he will be able to prepare his parcel of farmland with a plow, fertilizer, lima bean seedlings, and pecan fertilizer. This way he will be able to plant his crops, achieve a better harvest, and thereby improve his income. This will make it possible for him to continue striving to make his greatest dream a reality: to buy a piece of land and have his own house.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr:
Née vers 1972 à Bougouni, Madame Alimatou est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit son époux dans le quartier Médine de Bougouni.   
Madame Alimatou mène cette activité d’achat et de vente de charbon de bois il y’a environ dix ans. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commande en provenance surtout de Bamako. A l’approche de l’hivernage son activité devient de plus en plus danse. C’est ainsi, qu’elle décida d’adhérer au programme crédit  de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel  elle est à son 2 ème prêt individuel, le premier prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. Elle compte acheter avec ce 2 ème prêt  80 sacs de charbon de bois auprès des paysans producteurs. Elle les revendra en détail et en gros à une clientèle composée généralement de chefs de famille de la ville et des commerçants en provenance de Bamako.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs Alimatou was born circa 1972 in Bougouni. She's married and the mother of five children. She lives with her husband in the Médine neighborhood in Bougouni.

For ten years, she's been buying and selling charcoal. She enjoys a strong reputation in this business and receives a lot of orders, mainly from Bamako.

With the rainy season approaching, her business is gearing up. She decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which she's seeking her second loan. The first one was repaid without problems.

She intends to use this second loan to buy 80 sacks of charcoal from farmers. She will resell it retail and wholesale to a clientele comprising mainly heads of families and merchants coming from Bamako. 

Thanks to this loan, she intends to turn a monthly profit of XOF 50'000 (ca US$ 100), to be used to help cover family expenses and repay the loan. She will invest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:

Lorena requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. Lorena has been in this business for three years now. In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to puchase additional boxes of fish to sell

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

Tita is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional gasoline and motor oil to sell in her business.

Tita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional gasoline and motor oil to sell

loans.name: Corlita

texts.en:
Corlita is 49 years old, married and has ten children, four of whom are in school. Corlita is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Corlita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise. Corlita has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Corlita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia works hard to support her family. Emilia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Emilia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business such as fishing net, bamboo and wood. Emilia has been in this business for 21 years now.

In the future, Emilia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business such as fishing net, bamboo and wood.

loans.name: Rolinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children currently attending school, Rolinda works hard to support her family. She has a business selling nipa (woven palm mats) used for house repair and construction in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food and fish vending. Rolinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of nipa to sell.

Rolinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of nipa to sell

loans.name: Rogelyn

texts.en:
Rogelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling nipa (woven palm mats) used for house repair and construction in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of nipa to sell in her business. Rogelyn has been in this business for five years. Rogelyn also earns income from food and fish vending.

Rogelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of nipa to sell

loans.name: Rezil

texts.en:
Rezil is 29 years old. She is married and has three children who attend school. Rezil is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Rezil requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of nipa to sell. Rezil has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Rezil would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of nipa to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children from Jagna, Bohol. She is a vegetable farmer and has been in this business for more than 10 years now. 
Antonia is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the plants. With this, she will be able to grow and harvest healthy vegetables from the garden thus allowing her to sell more to the market. In the future, Antonia hopes to make her business a success and to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the plants

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business such as paint and wood for her furniture-making business. Annabelle has been in this business for two years. She also earns income from her general store.

Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business such as paint and wood.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 49 years old and married with five children. Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell such as soap, snack foods, spices, sugar and milk.

Elsie has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns income from buying and selling fish.

Elsie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell such as soap, snack foods, spices, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials such as fishing net, bamboo, wood and nails for her fishing business.

Jelly has been in this business for three years. Jelly also earns income from food vending.

Jelly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business such as fishing net, bamboo, wood and nails.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, six of whom are in school, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 30 years old and married with three children.

Teresa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell, like soap, snack foods, spices, sugar, milk, etc.

Teresa has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

Teresa aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell, like soap, snack foods, spices, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Emelida

texts.en:
Emelida is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Jagna, Bohol. 

She earns a living through her food vending business; selling home cooked snack foods to the people in her area. Emelida is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, butter, bananas, coconut milk and cooking oil. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more thus, augmenting her sales and income. 

In the future, Emelida hopes to expand her business so that she will be able to increase her earnings and send her children to school for better learning and education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, butter, bananas, coconut milk and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil. Comenzó a vender productos naturales, poco a poco fue incrementando su negocio. Trabajan todos los días desde muy temprano vende los productos naturales Onni Life (productos naturales). 

Una de las dificultades son los ladrones. La cliente es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, uno de 33 años quien es un joven adulto pero con discapacidad  ella  lo tiene que cuidar, otro de 14 y 2 años de edad. 

Ella tiene muchas aspiraciones con su familia por eso quiere seguir trabajando para mejorar su negocio y darle lo mejor a sus hijos. El préstamo lo usara para mejorar sus productos naturales comprando Onni Life, para el hígado, estomago, vitaminas. En el futuro quiere tener un local d y darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Guayaquil. She started selling natural products and gradually was able to increase her business. The borrower works every day, starting in the early morning hours, selling Omnilife natural products.

One of her difficulties is dealing with thieves. The borrower is a single mother with three children. One child, age 33, is a young adult who requires her care because of a disability. The other children are ages 14 and 2.

The borrower has many aspirations for her family. For this reason, she wants to continue working to improve her business and provide the best for her children. Her loan will be used to improve her Omnilife business by purchasing natural products for the liver and stomach, as well as vitamins. In the future, she wants to acquire a shop and provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy Omnilife natural products, such as vitamins and remedies for the liver and stomach.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Minda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice and buying and selling fish. Minda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Minda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is 22 years old and married with one child.

Vicky works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, snack foods, spices, sugar, milk, etc.

Vicky has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

Vicky aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, snack foods, spices, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Marilen

texts.en:
Marilen is a 42-year-old, married woman and mother to a 16-year-old.  They are from Jagna, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari or variety store selling various goods and items to the people, who live nearby.
 
Marilen is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, soda and beverages. soap and detergents, biscuits and chips. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers in her store thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Marilen hopes of making her business a success and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, soda and beverages, soap and detergents, biscuits and chips.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a two-door refrigerator as well as meats, chicken, ham, sausages, and chorizo.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Jagna, Bohol. 

She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than five years now. Celsa is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs. 

With this, she will be able to improve her business and eventually her earnings. Moreover, Celsa dreams continually of sending her children to school for better learning and education.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 24-year-old woman from Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol. Noreen operates and runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people nearby. Noreen is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like rice, soda, soap and detergents, canned goods and noodles. With this, she will be able to cater to more buyers in her store which then allows her to sell more more. 

In the future, Noreen hopes to expand her business in order to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like rice, soda, soap and detergents, canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rizzy Anne Mae

texts.en:
This is Rizzy, 29, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rizzy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. She also has an RTW business for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Rizzy dreams that her business will expand and that she will have other businesses. She hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nelson Neftali

texts.es: nelson de 28 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a su familia, es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y maicillo cuando ya esta su cosecha la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarlos, nelson desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Nelson, 28, is a very responsible man when it comes to his household obligations, and he has always been known for giving his family the best he can.  He works hard with cheerfulness and enthusiasm.  He is a farmer and grows corn and sorghum, and stores the harvested grain in the graineries shown in the photograph, and later sells the grain.  He wants to increase his sales volume and therefore visited the INTEGRAL offices to request a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.  

He hopes to be able to obtain the support he is requesting because he has no other income.  This will allow him to continue putting food on the family table without limitation.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Lukas

texts.es:
Lucas es un joven de 21 años de edad, lleno de sueños y metas por cumplir, cuenta que laboró por varios meses administrando un supermercado en su localidad, hasta que su padre le propuso comenzar a trabajar en un lote que ha acondicionado como parqueadero. Hoy labora en su propio negocio debido a que su padre le cedió una parte del terreno, en donde presta los servicios de parqueadero, lavado de autos y motocicletas. Con el fin de ampliar su capacidad, Lucas se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la construcción de ocho celdas para albergar un mayor número de vehículos.  
Su mayor sueño es seguir creciendo, adquirir conocimientos y experiencias dentro del sector, mejorando así la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucas, 21, is full of dreams and has many goals to meet.  He says he worked for several months managing a supermarket in his town, until his father proposed to him working in a parking lot.  Now he runs his own business because his father gave him part of the land, where he offers car and motorcycle parking and washing.

In order to increase his capacity, Lucas is requesting a loan to build eight parking spaces so he can hold more vehicles.  His greatest goal is to continue expanding and acquire knowledge and experience in the sector so he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To build eight vehicle parking spaces.

loans.name: Dmoa Alward Group

texts.en:
This group is called Dmoa Alward, which consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They are responsible for improving the living standards of their family. They have applied for a loan of 190,000 YER from AMB.

Suria is 28 years old, a single woman who works to provide her family. She lives in a poor area in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a nurse who has already completed her studies for a diploma. She has opened a small clinic for three years. She believes that she offers a great medical service to her patients. She is kind woman; she never took money from poor patients whose financial incomes are low. She would like to buy medical supplies to use in her clinic so she has applied for a youth loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to cover her customers' needs. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medical supplies to use in her clinic .

loans.name: Reina

texts.en: Reina is a 58-year-old, married woman and a mother of three grown up children from Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in a food vending business selling home-cooked foods to the people nearby. This is the primary source of her income. Reina is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, seasoning and rice. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more food thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Reina hopes of making her business a sustainable one.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, seasoning and rice.

loans.name: Aref

texts.en:
Aref is 33-years-old, a married man and has six children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. He works in the education ministry earning a low salary. He is smart man who thinks that his salary is not enough. 

Aref has been running a small call centre, established in house for eight years. He strives hard to meet his family's demands. He started his business with small capital provided by his father. Recently, his customers are small because of he would like to expand his business to offer for his customers what they need. So, he has applied for a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to buy phone accessories and recharge cards to increase his profit. He would like to buy a taxi to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories and recharge cards to use for his business.

loans.name: Mamou

texts.fr:
Madame Mamou est âgée de 55 ans et mère de 8 enfants. Elle vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Dialanicoro de Bougouni. 
N’ayant pas fréquentée l’école moderne très vite elle commença à mener des activités génératrices de revenus. C’est ainsi qu’elle décida de suivre sa sœur pour apprendre l’activité d’achat et de vente des condiments. Avec une expérience de plus de 5 ans, elle maitrise cette activité dans laquelle elle est très sollicitée et appréciée dans la ville. 
Dans le cadre de l’élargissement de ses activités, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance avec qui elle est à son premier prêt qui sera  utiliser pour acheter, 6 cartons de concentrée de  tomate,  5 cartons de cube maggi, 5 sacs d’oignon, 3 bidons d’huile  et 10 sacs de sel de cuisine iodé. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Bamako et la vente se fait au grand marché de Bougouni.
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 85 000 FCFA.  Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mamou is 55 years old and a mother of eight children. She lives with her husband and children in the Dialanicoro neighborhood of Bougouni. Not having gone to school, she quickly started working to earn a living. She decided to follow her sister and learn how to buy and sell condiments. With an experience of more than five years, she is very sought after and appreciated in the town. 

In order to expand her business, she decided to join the micro-finance institution [Soro Yiriwaso]. This is her first loan and she will use it to buy 6 cartons of tomato paste, five boxes of Maggi, 5 sacs of onions, 3 cans of oil, and 10 sacs of iodized kitchen salt. She procures her goods from a large market in Bamako and sells them in a large market in Bougouni. 

With this loan, she hopes to earn an average monthly income of 85,000 francs CFA. With these earnings, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 48-years-old, is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. Her husband earns a living working for a supermarket. Phuong supports her family through the income she earns from selling rice to the people in her community. She began this business three years ago. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Phuong intends to take a loan to buy more rice to stock her store and to pay for material to make rice sacks. The additional stock and material will enable her to increase her sales. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more rice to stock her store and material to make rice sacks.

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en:
Dieu is 58 years old and married with three children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn their income from selling soft drinks from their stall.  

Dieu started his business ten years ago. He intends to take a loan to gradually expand his business by buying a variety of different beverages and repair the stall to better serve his customers. 

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different beverages and repair his stall.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria tiene 49 años y se dedica a la compra y venta de ropas y joyas. Tiene 3 hijos de los cuales una está trabajando en  España, y desde allí ayuda un poco a su madre con un pequeño dinero que le manda. Maria aparte de su actividad se dedica a limpiar un departamento 3 veces a la semana, ella cuenta que trabaja arduamente para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Anteriormente trabajaba como empleada doméstica sin retiro y después empezó a trabajar como limpiadora en una empresa y de a poco empezó a comprar ropas y las vendía a sus compañeras de trabajo, se hizo de capital y empezó a vender joyas de platerías.
El sueño de la Sra. Maria es que su hija vuelva de España y así montar un salón donde pueda vender sus productos con su hija
Solicita el crédito para la compra de platerías (anillos, cadenas y pulseras, etc). Con esto podrá seguir con sus ventas y ayudando a sus hijos. Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por darle la oportunidad de acceder al crédito
texts.en:
Maria, 49, buys and sells clothing and jewelry.  She has three children, one of whom is working in Spain and sends small amounts of money to her mother when she can.  Maria also cleans an apartment three times a week and claims she works hard to be able to support her family.

She used to work as a domestic employee and then worked as a cleaning lady for a company.  Little by little she began buying and selling clothing to her co-workers, puting together enough capital to begin selling jewelery.

María's goal is for her daughter to return from Spain so they can set up a shop where both of them can work.

She is requesting a loan to buy jewelry (rings, chains and bracelets), so she can continue with her sales and help her children.  She is grateful to the Paraguaya Foundation for the opportunity to obtain a loan.

loans.use: To buy jewelry, such as rings, chains and bracelets, to sell.

loans.name: Mangane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mangane est marié et réside dans une famille traditionnelle avec  son épouse, ses trois enfants, son frère et autres parents à Hérémakono Nord, un des  quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Mangane n’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser dans les études, s’est initié à cette activité d’achat et de vente de radios, de radios-cassettes, de cassettes, de lunettes, etc il y a environ 7 ans. Son activité est menée à la gare routière de Bougouni avec une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales et surtout des routiers. Il est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décide d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour prendre un prêt. Il est à son premier prêt. Il veut ce prêt pour acheter à Bamako,  10 radios, 5 cartons de cassettes. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mangane is married and lives in a traditional family with this wife, his three children, his brother, and other parents in Herremakono Nord, one of the neighborhoods in the town of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of the republic of Mali). 

Mangane, not having a chance to progress in school, began his own business buying and selling radios, radio-cassette players, cassette tapes, glasses, etc. about seven years ago. He conducts his business at the Bougouni bus terminal with customers who are from all walks of life, especially drivers. He is very sought after by his customers for the quality of his products. 

In order to better satisfy his customers who are growing in number, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro-Yiriwaso and take out a loan. This is his first loan. He wants this loan to buy 10 radios and five boxes of cassette tapes from Bamako.  

He hopes to earn an average monthly income of 60,000 francs CFA, which will be used to take care of his family's expenses, pay the interest on the loan, and to invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy radios and cassette tapes

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Mariam est née vers 1966 est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle réside avec ses enfants chez son époux dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquentée l’école moderne, très vite elle commença à s'intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus.
Mariam fut d’abord vendeuse de condiments, puis de chaussures et de tissus mais sans réussite.  C’est ainsi qu’elle décide alors d’accompagner sa tente pour apprendre la vente de céréales. Avec une expérience de plus de 10 ans, elle maîtrise son activité dans laquelle elle est très sollicitée.
Elle mène son activité chez elle même et au grand marché de Bougouni. Afin d’agrandir son entreprise, elle décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, 1 tonne de maïs, 1 tonne de petit mil et 1/2 tonne de riz.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages  environnants.
Elle est à son sixième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés
Avec ce prêt elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA qui la permettra de subvenir à ses besoins tout en aidant son époux dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mariam was born around 1966 and is married and a mother of four children. She lives with her children at her husband's house in the Massablacoura neighborhood of Bougouni. Not having gone to school, she very quickly got started earning a living. 

Mariam first tried selling condiments, and then shoes and fabrics, but without success. Because of this, she decided to learn from her aunt how to sell cereals. She now conducts her business with more than ten years experience and is highly sought after. She makes her sales from home and from a large market in Bougouni.
