Lo que más le gusta de trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de poder estar con sus amigas, con quienes ha conformado el Banco Comunal en el que está, ya que viven en el mismo barrio y se conocen desde siempre, y han sido quienes la han ayudado y apoyado cada vez que lo ha necesitado.
texts.en:
Agueda is standing in the back row, behind a lady wearing a green sweater. Her eyes are closed because she is smiling. Agueda is a member of the communal bank Las Perlas y el Diamante [The Pearls and the Diamond]. They all have different activities, like selling at fairs, food sales, used and new clothes sales, and bakery, which is what Agueda does for a living.

Agueda sells desserts in fairs. She started selling popcorn with a cart three or four years ago and she has been selling desserts for two years now. Her siblings have helped her whenever she has had problems to buy ingredients for her desserts. With the loan, she will be able to buy ingredients to make desserts and apples to make caramelized apples. She believes that everything will work fine in this new cycle, which gives her peace of mind.

What Agueda likes the most of working with Fondo Esperanza is the fact that she can spend time with her friends, with who she built this communal bank. They all live in the same neighborhood and have known each other forever, and have given support and help whenever someone has had the need.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her desserts.

loans.name: Sahei Lom Group

texts.en:
Hetin lives a very busy life since she lives with her in-laws and has to take care of them. She is a caring daughter-in-law. She takes care of her in-laws, kids and also raises pigs. She joined "Sahei lom" group with four other economically active women and she is the featured borrower member. She is pictured with the raised hand.

Hetin raise pigs but she was never in the position to buy more than three piglets. The insufficient capital always paralyses Hetin from raising pigs in good numbers. The pig sty that she has is also small and she needs more money to buy piglets and feed too. She raises pigs near the house because her in-laws are old and she can't leave them on their own. She purchase feed for the pigs in stocks from the market because she doesn't have time to collect food for the pigs in the nearby fields. She barely collects food for the pigs.

With the Kiva loan she is planning to purchase two more piglets and renovate the present pig sty by extending the perimeter. Hetin says if her plan is successful, then she will open a bank account and make some savings so that she can build a house. At present her only savings are with the group and it is a small savings. She is elated to share that, with the assistance of the loan, she will now be able to construct a bigger pig sty and purchase two more piglets. She thanks WSDS and Kiva for reaching her and also requests to continue assisting the "Sahei Lom" group in the future.

loans.use: To purchase two more piglets and construct a bigger pig sty.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is 51 years old; he is married with four children. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

Fidel owns and operates a motorcycle transport service in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for over five years, and earns 15,000 PHP every month. 

He joined GDMPC in 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. She has four children and has been doing this work for 13 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

She will use the loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.

Agnes stated what is most enjoyable about farming is, 'Rearing livestock!' Her biggest challenge is, 'Low production due to low-yielding dairy animals.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Cheluk.'  Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. 

Agnes was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, and she said: 'Was first introduced to Juhudi by a friend.'  This client was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How I could boost production through acquisition of assets from an mfi.'  When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Agnes replied 'Will acquire a high yielding dairy animal.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Agnes owns the following: cow, poultry, motorcycle, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam, who appears in the photo, is a 48-year-old married man and a father to two sons and two daughters. He is employed and gets a small salary that is barely enough to cover the family's needs.

He is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new bedroom furniture in order to improve the living conditions in his house. Taking this loan will offer to Bassam and his wife comfortable furniture so both of them can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To buy new bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Ahed

texts.en:
Ahed is a single Palestinian young man. He is a worker in a carpentry workshop and earns a small salary that is barely enough to cover his needs. He is also a university student who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Ahed do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Ahed and improve his living conditions. 

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending help text: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase a new laptop.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 22-year-old single young man. He is employed and earns a small salary that is not enough to cover his needs. He is also a university student who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help him do his homework and reports and help him in his work. This will ensure a better future for him and improve his living conditions. Mohammad appears in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a new laptop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to supply her business with used and new clothing.

loans.name: Rashel

texts.en:
Rashel is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother to three sons and one daughter. Her husband works in agriculture, planting different types of vegetables.

For the past four years, Rashel has had a cosmetics store. She is well known among her customers and has a good reputation, which makes her project a profitable one, but she needs more support to expand and make some improvements.

Rashel is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of installing shelves and purchasing a new collection of cosmetics to sell. This will allow her to expand the scope of her work, improve her business and increase the family's income. Rashel is photographed in her store.

loans.use: To make new decorations and buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Enas

texts.en:
Enas is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother to three sons and two daughters. For the past five years, Enas and her husband have been working in agriculture with the rest of the family members, which is a profitable project and the only source of income for the family. 

Now Enas needs more support for improvements. She wants to contribute to the purchase of a greenhouse. She is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to provide a share of the family's costs of purchasing the greenhouse. It will allow them to produce a better crop and thus increase their sales and improve the family's income.

Enas is photographed in the picture with her husband and one of their daughters.

loans.use: To buy a greenhouse for agriculture.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, who appears in the photo, is a 28-year-old single young man. He is an Accountant in the Council of the village where he lives and earns a low salary that is barely enough to cover all his needs.

He has completed building his own house, and now he wants to finish it, so he is requesting a 1,000 USD Youth loan to help him cover the cost of installing new windows and doors on his house.

Taking this loan will offer Mohammad suitable home conditions so he can enjoy living in his house soon.

loans.use: To install new windows and doors on the house.

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
Airene is 24 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by cultivating seaweed in the Philippines. Airene has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from selling gasoline and from food vending. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seeds, bamboo, wood, etc. for her business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, bamboo, wood, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen is 19 years old and single. She earns a living by cultivating seaweed in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her business, like nylon, bamboo, wood, etc. Arlen is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business, like nylon, bamboo, wood, etc.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, three of whom are  in school, Arlene works hard to support her family. She has a buying and selling of dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing and seaweed culture. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. Arlene hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elisa works hard to support her family. She has a fish-selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling squid.  Elisa is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish selling business.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Feleciana

texts.en:
Feleciana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has business buying and selling sea cucumbers in the Philippines. 

Feleciana is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of sea cucumbers to sell. Feleciana has been in this business for five years and earns more income from fishing.

Feleciana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of sea cocumbers to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from fishing and seaweeds culture.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Catalina dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Hodeliza

texts.en:
Hodeliza is 25 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, snack foods, spices, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

Hodeliza has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling  distilled water and charcoal.

Hodeliza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, snack foods, spices, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Jinelda

texts.en:
Jinelda is married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jinelda is 32 years old and five of her children are in school.

Jinelda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Jinelda has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jinelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Joesita

texts.en:
Joesita is 29 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by growing seaweed in the Philippines. Joesita is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seaweed seeds, bamboo, wood, etc.

Joesita has been culturing seaweed for 10 years and also earns additional income from fishing and buying and selling seaweed.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweed seeds, bamboo, wood, etc.

loans.name: Ntahalia Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chiregano est conseillère  du collectif d’affaire Ntahalia, jeune entrepreneur dynamique,  âgée de 29  ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Son conjoint est un chauffeur taximan. La cliente est vendeuse des fruits. Toute fois, elle vend aussi d’autres produits alimentaires (Maïs, ignames, haricots, etc.). Elle installe ses produits au marché et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença cette affaire depuis sa jeunesse, avec  le fonds reçu de son grand père. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  2 paniers des fruits prunes, 10 régimes de bananes,  2 bassins d’oranges, avocats, etc.  Les détériorations, les pourritures de fruits, absence de technologie de conservation,  l’insécurité dans les milieux ruraux sont de défis majeurs pour son activité.  Elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants et accroitre l’entreprise. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit
texts.en:
The client Chiregano is the adviser for the business collective of Ntahalia. Chiregano is a dynamic young entrepreneur, 29 years old, and married with four children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Chiregano is a fruit seller. All the same, she also sells other food products (corn, yams, beans, etc.). Chiregano sells her merchandise in the market and sometimes from her home.

Chiregano started this business in her youth, with funds received from her grandfather. This new loan will be used to buy two baskets of plums, ten bunches of bananas, two baskets of oranges, avocados, etc.

Damage to the produce, rotting fruit, a lack of conservation technology, and insecurity in rural areas are major challenges for her business. Chiregano hopes to educate her children and help her business to grow. Chiregano would also like to give special thanks to Hekima for her micro loan support.

loans.use: to buy two baskets of plums, ten bunches of bananas, two baskets of oranges, avocados, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Diego Alejandro

texts.es:
Diego Alejandro  de 23 años de edad, es un joven apasionado por su trabajo, asegura que la mecánica se convirtió en un gran reto para el. Comenzó a laborar desde los 15 años es un pequeño taller, allí aprendió de la actividad y desde hace seis meses logró montar en compañía con su familia su propio negocio. Uno de sus mayores sueños es  ingresar a la universidad y graduarse como ingeniero, por lo cual se encuentra ahorrando para iniciar con su proyecto de vida. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de parches, calibradores y herramientas de mano, con el fin de mejorar la calidad en el servicio. Espera que con dicha inversión pueda aumentar sus ingresos y pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Diego Alejandro, age 23, is a young man who is passionate about his work. He has taken on a great challenge with mechanics. He started working at the age of 15 in a small workshop, where he learned this job. Six months ago, he was able to open his own business with his family. One of his greatest dreams is to go to university and graduate with an engineering degree. He is saving up to start this life project. 
He is currently requesting a loan for the purchase of patches, gauges, and hand tools. His goal is to improve the quality of his service. With this investment, he hopes to increase his income and pay for his studies.

loans.use: to buy patches, gauges, and hand tools.

loans.name: Italo Antonio

texts.es: Don italo de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa el se dedica a la reparacion de todo tipo de maquinas de coser industriales, electricas o manuales con las reparaciones que realiza logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar, Don italo solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar mas repuestos de muy buena calidad para seguir con su trabajo y sastifacer a sus clientes asi el podra tener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran en su hogar.
texts.en: Don Italo, age 54, lives in his own home with his wife. He repairs all kinds of industrial sewing machines, electric or manual. These repairs allow him to cover his household costs. Italo is requesting a loan which will allow him to be able to buy more spare parts of very good quality in order to continue with his work and satisfy his customers. This way, he will have more income to help his household.

loans.use: to buy pieces of machinery.

loans.name: Rosa Esther

texts.es: La señora Rosa, habita en el municipio de Masaya en el Comarca llamada Sacuanjoche, junto a su familia e hijos, mujer trabajadora desde muy joven, su mayor prioridad hoy en dia son sus hijos y darle  las mejores condicones posibles, ella tiene un negocio hubicado en su casa de habitacion, que es elaboracion de Pan, ella distribuye su producto a todas las pulperias del municipio y vende en su casa tambien, con este negocio a sacado adelante a su familia y ha ayudado a otras familias ya que emplea a 4 personas y asi ayuda en la comunidad, con este credito compra Materia prima como:Arina, Levadura, Sartenes , Leche, Azucar, Manteca, Leña etc. Agradece el Apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa lives in the municipality of Masaya, in a region called Sacuanjoche, with her family and children. She has been a hard-working woman from a very young age. Her greatest priority now is her children: to give them the best possible conditions. She has a business in her home, making bread. She distributes her product to all the general stores in the municipality and also sells from home. With this business, she has gotten her family ahead and also helped other families; she employs four people, thus helping out in the community.
With this loan, she will buy basic supplies such as: flour, yeast, pans, milk, sugar, butter, and firewood. She is grateful for the support of Afodenic and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 46 years old, married, and has three children.  She earns a living by selling seaweed cultured in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 23 years.  She also earns additional income from fishing. 

Marina is requesting a loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase materials such as wood, nylon, bamboo, etc.  She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as wood, nylon, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Jhon Fredy

texts.es:
Jhon Fredy de 39 años de edad se ha dedicado durante toda su vida a la venta de frutas y verduras de manera ambulante, recorre diariamente las calles de su barrio y otros sectores cercanos. Desde hace 4 años logró obtener el permiso para comercializar sus productos. Labora de 7:00 am a 6:00 pm de lunes a sábado.  
En la actualidad desea cambiar su carrera debido al mal estado en el que se encuentra e invertir en la compra de surtido con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. En un futuro próximo desea tener su negocio en un punto fijo y generar empleos directos a su familia.
texts.en:
Jhon Fredy, age 39, has dedicated his whole life to the sale of fruits and vegetables on the street. He walks the streets of his neighbourhood and the surrounding sectors every day. Four years ago, he was able to obtain permission to sell his products. He works from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm Monday to Saturday. 
He now wants to change his cart because it is in bad shape. He also wants to invest in the purchase of more stock in order to increase his income and improve his family's quality of life. In the near future he wants to have his business at a fixed location and generate a direct income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a cart and fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
As a married mother of five, Carolina works hard to support her family. She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing, operating a general store and selling cultured seaweeds.

Carolina, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF, is now borrowing PHP 25000 to buy additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, yeast, margarine, etc. for her bakery. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, margarine, etc.

loans.name: Cristian George

texts.es:
Cristian es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Cristian no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su madre, Cristian trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Cristian se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una pequeña lavadora, la cual le servirá de mucho a él y a su madre, quien a pesar de los años trabaja como lavandera, pero debido a una severa dolencia ya no puede lavar a mano, por ello Cristian desea apoyarla brindándole una maquina que la ayude en su trabajo, así pues Cristian seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un buen empresario y junto a su familia desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Cristian is a 20-year-old single man living in the city of Ica in Parcona District with his parents and siblings.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  Unfortunately, due to the lack of resources and the need to start working while still very young to help his parents, Cristian has been unable to study Business Administration at a university but would like to be able to do so.  In his free time he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and sometimes cooks a delicious Chicken with Rice to share with his family.

With much effort and dedication and thanks to his mother’s support, Cristian works as a mototaxi driver providing urban transportation services.  He works every day for about 12 hours and thinks he does well because of his sense of responsibility and because he knows the areas where the largest number of passengers can be found.

Cristian is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to buy a small washing machine that will be of great use for him and his mother who despite her age works as a laundress but due to a serious malady is unable to wash by hand and this is why Cristian wants to buy her a washing machine to help with her work and Cristian will continue working and striving towards reaching his great dream of becoming a good businessman; he wants to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge a sus 52 años, se caracteriza por se un hombre luchador y esmerado por salir adelante. Trabaja en su propia tienda desde hace más de 5 años, en la que genera el sustento diario para el y su familia. Actualmente, el señor jorge requiere de la compra de productos de la canasta familiar con el fin de suplir la demanda de sus clientes,  lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su mayor sueño es tener su tienda bien surtida y fidelizar sus clientes.
texts.en: At the age of 52, Jorge is noted for being a hardworking man who is focused on getting ahead.  He has worked in his own store for more than five years; it generates daily support for him and his family.  At present, Jorge needs to buy basic staple items to meet customer demand.  This will make it possible for him to increase his income and improve his family’s quality of life.  His greatest dream is to have a well-stocked store and to secure his customers’ regular patronage.

loans.use: to buy basic staples to stock his store.

loans.name: Choxbajan Tres Group

texts.es:
La señora Aura Marina de estado civil casada, cuenta con 33 años de edad, curso 4 años de educacion primaria, tiene 5 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando; ella se dedica a la elaboración de canastillas, este negocio le fue heredado por sus padres y de esa manera fue como inició y hasta el momento lleva ya 8 años de experiencia. También cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciante.

Organiza un grupo y decide solicitar un prestamo que lo utilizará para la compra de materiales para la elaboracion de sus canastillas, en el futuro quiere tener mas capital para poder procudir mas y vender por mayor; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a artesanía y comercio.
texts.en:
Aura Marina, 33, is married; she completed four years of elementary school and has five children two of which attend school.  She works weaving baskets, a business she inherited from her parents which is how she started out; to date she has 8 years’ experience.  She also has her husband’s support; he’s a merchant.

She organized a group and decided to request a loan that will be used to buy basket-weaving supplies.  In future, she’d like to have more capital to be able to produce more and sell at wholesale.  The other group members work in crafts and in commerce.

loans.use: to buy basket weaving supplies.

loans.name: Julia Inés

texts.es:
Julia de 42 años de edad y madre de una hija, se dedica al oficio de la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace diez años. Trabaja fuertemente con el fin de generar ingresos para su manutención y la de su familia. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos como hilos, botones, cordones y resortes. Con el fin de atender y cumplir con el número de pedidos con los que cuenta en la actualidad.
Su mayor deseo es brindarle a su hija la oportunidad de ingresar a la educación superior y formarse como profesional, con el propósito de acceder a mejores condiciones laborales.
texts.en: Julia, 42, is the mother of one daughter; she has worked making clothes for the last ten years.  She works hard aiming at generating income for her and her family’s support.  Today, she’s requesting a loan to buy supplies like thread, buttons, cords and elastic in order to fill a number of pending orders she currently has.  Her greatest wish is to provide her daughter with the opportunity of attending college to become a professional so she can have access to better employment conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Candelaria Amelia

texts.es: Doña Candelaria de 44 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijas de 15 y 18 años de edad, las cuales se dedican a estudiar, viven en casa propia, Candelaria es una madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas y también de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación. Candelaria solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en: Candelaria, 44, is a single mother of two daughters who are 15 and 18 years of age and attend school; they live in her own house.  Candelaria’s a very responsible and hardworking mother who has managed to move her family forward.  She owns a grocery store where she sells food items like bread, soft-drinks, oil, vegetables, fruit and snacks and also basic staples like soap and shampoo, among others; the store is located at home.  Candelaria is requesting a loan to better stock the store so she can provide better customer service thus improving sales which is her priority in order to support her home.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional baskets of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Prudencia has been in this business for 30 years. Prudencia earns more income from buying and selling meat and whole roasted pigs.

Prudencia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional baskets of fish to sell

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rizza works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Rizza is borrowing 15000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing  business.

Rizza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets for her business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 45 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional soap, snack foods, spices, sugar, milk, and other items to sell. 

Rosalina has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional soap, snack foods, spices, sugar, milk, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Yoeurn's Group

texts.en: A 59-year-old widower father from Battambang province, Yoeurn is one of the villagers who struggles to make a living from rice farming and working for others for a fee. He has been involved in his current business for four years, earning about 18,000 KHR per day. This is the third microloan for Yoeurn’s group, which comprises two members. The past two loans, which he has fully repaid, have better supported his business. Now, he and his joint member are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, he will use his loan portion for the new cycle to pay plowing fees and labor costs and to buy rice seed and fertilizer. He hopes the new loan will grow his business greater than before and improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay plowing fees and labor costs and to buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Liliana María

texts.es:
Liliana de 36 años, es madre de dos hijos menores edad. Debido a la condición económica en su hogar, Liliana optó por generar una fuente de ingresos alterna para mejorar la calidad de vida familiar, debido a que su esposo labora como mensajero y los ingresos no alcanzan a cubrir todas las necesidades del hogar y la educación de sus hijos.
Con el fin de cuidar de su familia y no abandonar sus labores domésticas, decidió vender mercancía desde su casa. Asegura que esta actividad le proporciona buenos ingresos, por lo cual se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido como ropa, calzado y accesorios, con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores ingresos que le permitirán mejorar las condiciones económicas de su hogar.
texts.en:
Liliana, 36, is the mother of two minor children.  Due to her home’s economic situation, Liliana opted for generating an alternative source of income in order to improve the family’s quality of life because her husband works as a messenger and income is insufficient to cover all household expenses and her children’s education.

Aiming at caring for her family while not neglecting her household chores, she decided to sell merchandise at home.  She assures that this activity provides good income which is why she’s looking for a loan to invest in the purchase of stock merchandise like clothes, shoes and accessories in order to increase sales and generate higher income that will make it possible for her to improve her home’s economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and accessories.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María de 47 años de edad, es ama de casa, Desde hace un año le ayuda a su esposo con las gastos del hogar, elabora pasteles de pollo y carne los cuales distribuye en las tiendas y cafeterías del sector.
Gracias a la generación de nuevos ingresos, María considera que la calidad de vida familiar ha mejorado. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una freidora e insumos como maíz, pollo y carne, para aumentar su producción.
Su mayor sueño es montar su propia cafetería y laborar en conjunto con su esposo.
texts.en:
María, 47, is a housewife.  She’s been helping her husband with household expenses for the last year.  She makes chicken and meat pies that she sells to stores and local cafés in her neighborhood.  

Thanks to this new source of income, María feels that her family’s quality of life has improved which is why she’s asking for a loan to buy a fryer and ingredients like corn, chicken and meat to increase production.  Her greatest dream is being able to open her own café and to work alongside her husband.

loans.use: to buy a fryer and ingredients like corn, chicken and meat.

loans.name: Wilmar

texts.en:
Wilmar is 37-years-old, married and has four children.

She earns a living by seaweed culturing in the Philippines. Wilmar is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, bamboo, seaweed seeds, etc.

Wilmar has been in seaweed culturing for 26 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, bamboo, seaweed, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Samoeun's Group

texts.en: Samoeun is 51-years-old and a married father of three children. He is a peasant who does corn planting on four hectares of farmland located in Bovel district of Battambang province where his residential area is. To better feed the family, his wife also works for others for a fee during her spare time from the farmland. The 10 year involvement in the current business has returned him about 34,400 KHR per day. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Samoeun and his co-borrower, in the group of two, are first time borrowers seeking the loan of 1,500,000 KHR each. As the group leader, he will spend his loan portion to plow his farmland and to buy rice seed, potash, and insecticide for his farmland. He deeply hopes that he can gain high productivity from his crops and make more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, potash, and insecticide for his farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to by a cart with wheels and to buy avocados.

loans.name: Vinda's Group

texts.en: Being one of the breadwinners in the family consisting of six children, one of whom is still in school, Vinda is 55-years-old and a farmer growing cassava as the primary source of her family’s income. To earn extra income, her husband is a cooking chef for weddings. Vinda has been in the current business for 10 years. She has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, and now she and two other villagers are in the same group. She is seeking for 3,000,000 KHR while her fellow group members are seeking for 1,500,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay for plowing fees and to buy good rice seeds for re-planting. She hopes this loan will help her support her business on time and to gain double output to improve her living.

loans.use: to buy good rice seeds for re-planting

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en:
Age 40 and a local citizen from Battambang province, Chanthorn is married and has five children. Currently, only two children are under her dependency as they are still in school. To overcome the family’s daily basic needs, she and her husband do corn and rice cropping on five hectares area; the business that she has been with for six years and is able to earn up to 32,200 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Chanthorn’s group of two female members. For this loan, she is requesting the amount of 1,500,000 KHR whereas her co-borrower is applying for 650,000 KHR.   As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay for plowing fees, and to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide. She hopes to increase her income so that she can keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, and to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide

loans.name: Memelyn

texts.en: Memelyn lives in Ubay, Bohol with her family. For ten years now, she and her husband have been engaged in farming and fishing. She has two children, ages 11 and 12. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, nylon, and fish nets for her business. She hopes that someday she can venture into other business options so she can improve her income for her family. Memelyn hopes that she can send her children to school for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, nylon, and fish nets.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier, tiene la edad de 33 años, está casado y vive con su esposa y 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos necesarios como abonos, plaguicidas y herbicidas para mantener su cultivo en buen estado. El cuenta con varios años ya de experiencia en el manejo de café por lo cual ve como necesario esta inversión para mejorar su cultivo. El espera también así poder obtener del mismo una muy buena cosecha para salir con los repagos del préstamo. A su vez piensa incrementar su cosecha y generar más ingresos económicos para el bienestar de su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Javier, 33, is married living with his wife and two children who are his main priority.  He intends to use the loan to buy needed supplies like manure, insecticide and herbicide to keep his crops in good condition.  He has several years’ experience growing coffee which leads him to the need for this investment to improve his crops.  He also hopes thus to obtain a very good harvest so that he can repay the loan.  At the same time, he plans to increase his crop yield and generate good income to support his family.

This is his first loan from Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur has offered him the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: Don emilio de 63 años es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a sus hijo. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijo de 24 y 17 años de edad se dedica a ser agricultor cosecha maiz y tiene una crianza de ganado con las ganacias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se presentan en su hogar. Don Emilio desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso a solicitado un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, comida para su ganado, entre otras cosas, para seguir llevando el pan de cada dia a su hogar.
texts.en:
Emilio, 63, is a man who is very responsible with his household obligations because he’s always been noted for providing the best for his children.  He currently lives with his wife and two children who are 24 and 17 years of age.  He works in agriculture growing corn and also raises cattle.  With profits obtained from his sales he manages to cover household expenses that come up.

Emilio wants to increase sales which is why he’s requesting a loan to buy seeds, manure and cattle feed, among others to continue providing his home’s daily bread.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea, 32, is married and blessed with three little kids all residing in Battambang province. The rest of his family relies on the agricultural activity of corn and cassava cultivation. This is the business that he has engaged in for 10 years and is able to generate about 20,000 KHR per day. Sophea is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He is seeking his first loan of 2,500,000 KHR in order to buy seeds, potash, insecticide, and to plow his farmland. Additionally, he will also use a portion of it to lease a plot of farmland to grow more cash-crops. He hopes that his loan will help him to make triple income so that he can set aside savings for his children when they are aged for schooling.

loans.use: to lease a plot of farmland to grow more cash-crops

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province, Touch is married and has five children. Currently, two of her three dependent children are in school. Corn and rice farming are the main sources of income available to Touch for covering her daily cost of living. Her current business, which she has had for ten years, earns her about 10,000 KHR per day. 

Now, she and her fellow group member are requesting their first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Touch, as the group leader, will use her loan to plow her farmland and to purchase seed. She hopes this loan will support her business and help her to earn more profit.

loans.use: to plow her farmland and to purchase seed.

loans.name: Sokny

texts.en:
A corn grower from Battambang province, Sokny is 46 years old and has two children. She has been planting corn for 11 years and is able to earn about 34,000 KHR per day. Now, she is short of working capital to support her farmland. Therefore, she is taking her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to overcome this challenge. 

Sokny is seeking 1,500,000 KHR in order to pay for plowing fees, lease farmland, and to buy seeds and potash. She hopes to earn more profit so she can maintain good living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay plowing fees, lease farmland, and to buy seeds and potash.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
A mother from Battambang province, Phally is 40 years old and makes a living farming rice. She has three children, two of whom are in school.

Phally, a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is seeking 1,200,000 KHR in order to buy good rice seed for growing. She hopes to harvest her crop on time and gain a good yield, which will increase her income and better her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy good rice seed.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera. Desde hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura; oficio que aprendió de sus padres. Ella trabaja junto a su hermano, quienes se levantan a las 4:00 a.m. a prepararse e irse al terreno en donde cultivan maíz, antes de marcharse deben ordeñar las vacas y vender la lache que sacan. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar semilla, abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, etc. y cancelar el pago por el alquiler del terreno. Su objetivo con la inversión, es realizar sus cultivos, para tener maíz para su consumo y poder vender a otras personas ya que desea adquirir más vacas lecheras para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Eva is 37 years old and single. She has been farming for several years since she learned this trade from her parents. Eva works with her brother and they wake up at 4:00 A.M. so that they can get ready and head toward the plot of land where they grow corn. Prior to that they must milk the cows so that they can sell whatever is produced.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy seeds, compost, herbicides, pesticides, and other supplies. She will also pay the rent on her farmland. Her goal with this investment is to complete her crop cycle so that she can have corn for consumption and to sell to other people. Eva would like to acquire more dairy cows so that she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, herbicides, pesticides, and other supplies, as well as pay the rent on her farmland.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Sary, 35, is a mother of seven children. She is a local villager from the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She earns a living and  sustains her family via rice farming, while her husband earns extra income catching and selling fish. She has been with her current business for ages. 

Including this loan, Sary and her fellow group member are third-cycle clients with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Sary has wisely managed her past loans to support her business and gain a decent income for her family. Now, she is seeking 1,000,000 KHR, while her co-borrower is applying for 300,000 KHR. 

Sary, who is the group leader, will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and seed and to pay plowing fees. She hopes this loan will positively impact her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed and to pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Sarou's Group

texts.en:
Sarou, 28, is the mother of five children who are still in school. This big family resides in Battambang Province’s Ek Phnom district and counts on rice farming for income. Sarou has been involved in this business for five years and earns about 28,000 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Sarou and her co-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans have gradually improved Sarou's lifestyle. Now, she is seeking 1,000,000 KHR, the same amount as her group member. Sarou will spend her portion of the loan to buy potash and seed and to pay plowing fees. She expects to improve her harvest and earn more income for her kids’ sake.

loans.use: to buy potash and seed and to pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en:
Saret, a mother of two children residing in Kampong Cham province, is 25 years old. For the entire family, fish catching for resale and selling vegetables are the main sources of income, which she has been involved in for 7 years and is able to earn up to 17,000 KHR per day. 

Saret, a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), has repaid back her past loan completely and it has relieved her family’s burden. Now, she and her co-borrower are seeking for 1,000,000 KHR and 1,400,000 KHR, respectively. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fishing outfits and more vegetables for resale. Her deepest hope is that she can make double income from both her businesses.

loans.use: to buy fishing outfits and more vegetables for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 38 years old, married, and has four children.  She is  from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. Olivia relies on her fishing business, which she has been doing for four years, to support her family. 

Olivia is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy fishing net and styrofoam to store her fresh fish. Olivia and her husband work hard to support their family’s needs, especially for food and school fees. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and live an abundant life out of her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and styrofoam.

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 48 años, es soltera, tiene 3 hijos Andrea de 18 años que ingresará a la universidad, Bryan y Diego de 14 y 11 años respectivamente quienes estudian en un colegio público. María fue madre soltera desde muy joven y por sus hijos ha trabajado duro para poder pagar una educación digna de la cual ella no pudo gozar ya que por los escasos recursos económicos en su hogar, alcanzó a terminar solo la escuela primaria. Esta mujer esforzada sueña con ver a sus tres hijos convertidos en profesionales y además poder ser dueña de un local amplio donde pueda atender su restaurante. María vive actualmente en el cantón de San Miguel de Los Bancos un pueblo que es muy visitado por las cascadas y biodiversidad de especies que se pueden observar en el paso por sus paisajes. Un lugar dueño de una exquisita gastronomía en comida típica que es comercializada por varios de sus habitantes y que conjuntamente con hoteles, almacenes agropecuarios y oferta de deportes extremos aportan al crecimiento económico de la ciudad. También en el sector rural hay hogares que se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería de donde también se destaca el procesamiento de leche y derivados como queso, manjar, etc. 
María desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de comida elaborada al carbón, paralelamente a esta labor ella se desempeña como ama de casa atendiendo a sus hijos y dedicándoles el tiempo que demandan. Los fines de semana son  clave para la venta de su comida, por lo que la mayoría de horas trabaja en estos días. La necesidad de un empleo llevó a esta mujer a emprender en esta actividad que aprendió empíricamente y por su propio esfuerzo. María vive en una casa a la cual desde hace tiempo atrás le hacen falta algunos acabados, es por esto que ahora requiere un préstamo que lo invertirá en materiales y mano de obra para que su casa quede terminada y así ella y sus hijos puedan vivir en un ambiente confortable y con un mejor estilo de vida. Anteriormente no había podido hacer estos arreglos porque su principal obstáculo era la dificultad de conseguir un crédito, sin embargo gracias a las recomendaciones de algunos amigos pudo llegar a Fundación Alternativa quienes le brindaron agilidad, confianza y asesoría oportuna y quienes además le brindaron el producto de Kiva con el cual varias personas de varios lugares del mundo podrán formar parte de su sueño.
texts.en:
María, 48, is single and has three children: Andrea, 18, who is about to start university and Bryan and Diego who are 14 and 11 respectively and attend public school.  María has been a single mother since a young age and has worked hard for her children to pay for a proper education for them, something she was unable to have because of her home’s limited economic resources; she was only able to finish elementary school.

This self-sacrificing woman dreams with seeing her three children become professionals and also with being the owner of a spacious locale for her restaurant.  María currently lives in San Miguel de Los Bancos Canton, a town that’s very popular due to its waterfalls and its biodiversity that can be enjoyed in its different environments.  It’s a place with delicious cuisine comprised of traditional dishes that various residents sell and together with hotels, agricultural warehouses and extreme sports contribute to the city’s economic growth.  Also, in the rural zones there are homes dedicated to agriculture and animal husbandry where milk production and production of dairy products like cheese, cream, etc. stand out.

For the last two years María has worked producing charcoal grilled food and is also a housewife tending to her children and giving them the time they require.  Weekends are key to selling her food so most of the hours she works are on these days.  The need to work led this woman to start this activity which was self-taught and based on her own efforts.  

María lives in a house that has needed some improvements for some time now which is why she needs a loan now to invest in building supplies and labor costs so that her house will be finished and she and her children can live comfortably and with a better lifestyle.

She hadn’t been able to do these improvements previously because her main obstacle was the difficulty in getting a loan. However, thanks to recommendations from some friends she was able to reach out to Fundación Alternativa who offered her speed, trust and timely advice and also offered Kiva product by means of which many people in many parts of the world can be part of her dream.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Celina

texts.es: Celina, tiene la edad de 56 años, está casada y vive con su esposo que es su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar terneros para tenerlos en sus repastos. Ella cuenta con un pequeños repastos que están sin uso por lo cual quiere aprovechar para aumentar el número de animales a su poder y sacarle provecho al terrenito. Ella espera poder tenerlos rápido para su venta y así generar ingreso para salir con su crédito y mejorarle a su esposo la estabilidad económica de su hogar.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Celina, 56, is married living with her husband who is her main priority.  She intends to use the loan to buy calves to put out to pasture.  She has small pasture lands that are lying fallow so she wants to use them to increase her herd size and take advantage of her small plot of land.  She hopes to get them soon so she can sell them and repay her loan and help her husband improve their home’s economic stability.

This is the first loan she’s gotten from Fudecosur.  She’s had no previous loans from state banks and Fudecosur offered her the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Bernardo Brumo

texts.es:
Bernardo tiene 32 años de edad  de estado civil unión libre tiene 2 hijos vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos .

Es integrante de ventanilla V.R.C.  Virgen de Guadalupe que se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Puerto  Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica  a  labores agropecuarias.
 
Bernardo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz,  Además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas. 

Solicita el crédito para mejorar el cultivo comprando insumos, fertilizantes, insecticidas y otros.

 Las compras y ventas realizan en ventanas. Su sueño es seguir mejorando el cultivo. 

El desafío que enfrenta es combatir contra la naturaleza.

 En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Bernardo, 32, is in a common law relationship and has two children; he lives in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “Virgen de Guadalupe” communal bank located in Puerto Pechinche Canton belonging to Pueblo Viejo Canton; this communal bank works in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Bernardo works in agriculture growing corn and rice and also raises chickens.  He’s requesting the loan to improve his crops buying supplies, fertilizer, insecticide and others.  His purchases and sales take place in Ventanas.  His dream is to continue improving his crops.  The challenge he faces is battling nature.  He likes playing sports in his free time.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, a resident of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, is 47 years old and has three children who currently are farmers. To provide for the family's daily food needs, she and her husband grow paddy rice, a business they have been involved in for a long time.

Mom is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her original loan improved her standard of living. Now, she is part of a group of three members applying for a new loan. The total amount of the entire group loan is 2,100,000 KHR. Mom, who is the group leader, will use 700,000 KHR to buy rice seed and potash and to pay plowing fees. She hopes this loan will boost her crop productivity and help her improve her profits and her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and potash and to pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Sochea's Group

texts.en: A mother of two schoolchildren originally from Kampong Cham province, Sochea is 28-years-old and married. She makes a living by selling grocery items while her husband catches fish for resale for extra income. She has been with the current business for 9 years. Her previous loan was the first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has managed to utilize her past loan to upgrade her living progressively and has successfully repaid back the past loan. Now, she joins a group of three members as the group’s leader. For Sochea, she will use her portion to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes that she can replenish her grocery items on time and increase her client base, in order to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en: Sarim, 47, is a father of two children and lives in Kandal province. To deal with daily costs of living, he has a decent job as a journalist whereas his wife is a clothes’ seller. He has engaged with this occupation for 10 years. Including this cycle, he is the fourth-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  He has made good use of his past three loans to support his wife’s business and stabilize his living condition. For this cycle, he is seeking a new loan to buy more clothes for his wife to sell.  He hopes that he can support his wife's business and make more income to keep his kids in school.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for his wife to sell

loans.name: Misael

texts.es: misael se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra maiz y maicillo y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su mama y papa en casa propia a quienes ayuda en los gastos pues ya estan muy mayores de edad y no pueden trabajar, misael esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como abonos, pesticidas, semillas,entre otras cosas para su cosecha ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener un mejor estabilidad economica con sus padres
texts.en:
Misael has worked in agriculture for several years; he grows corn and sorghum and uses profits from crop sales to cover his household expenses.  He’s a responsible, honest, hardworking man living with his mother and father in their own house; he helps them with expenses since they are quite elderly and unable to work.

Misael is asking for a loan to be able to buy farm supplies like manure, pesticide and seeds, among others for his crops because what he earns is not enough to cover these expenses thus earning higher income to have better economic stability with his parents.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Hoeurng's Group

texts.en:
Hoeurng, 59, is a widowed mother of four children. Currently only one daughter still needs her support as she is still in school. Hoeurng earns a living as a single mother through paddy rice cultivation and working for others for a fee. She is able to earn about 15,000 KHR from her current business, which she has been involved in for 30 years. 

Hoeurng has been with VisionFund (Kiva's Partner) for five loan cycles. After her previous successful loans, which she repaid completely, she feels confident that she can further improve her standard of living. 

Now, Hoeurng is the leader of a two-member group. She is seeking 400,000 KHR, and her fellow group member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. Hoeurng will make good use of this loan to buy potash for her farmland. She hopes this purchase will help her to gain more income to support her family and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy potash for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Soeun, 52, is a villager from Kampong Cham province’s Thbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. With support from her husband, Soeun plants rice. She has been in this business for 17 years. 

Soeun has never worked with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now, she is in need of working capital to build a decent house. Therefore, she is seeking her first loan of 2,000,000 KHR to pay a house builder. She hopes that this loan will help her to own a proper house.

loans.use: to pay to for construction.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Oeun's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province, Oeun is 45 years old and a mother of three children. To tackle the family’s hardships, she grows rice. She has been engaged in her current business for 25 years. 

This is the second loan cycle for Oeun and her fellow group member with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She used her past loan, which she repaid with success, to effectively support a timely harvest and gain a good yield. For this cycle, she is seeking 2,000,000 KHR, and her fellow group member is applying for the same amount. As the leader, Oeun will use her loan portion to buy two hectares of farmland for growing cassava. She hopes to double her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy two hectares of farmland for growing cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ren

texts.en: A father of four children, Ren is 64-years-old and a farmer from Sa Ang district of Kandal province. He grows beans on one hectare and half area to support his family.  He has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past three cycles, and feels confident that he can maintain a good standard of living for his family. Now, he is seeking a fourth loan to buy fertilize, potash, and seeds for his crops. He hopes that he can gain double yield and make more profit for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, potash, and seeds for his crops

loans.name: Sinoun's Group

texts.en:
Sinoun, a young 27-year-old mother of two little kids, is a local citizen from Sa Ang district of Kandal province,Cambodia. She is a grocery vendor in her local area and her husband works for others for a fee as a truck driver. She is able to earn up to 20,000 KHR per day from the current business that she has occupied for 7 years. 

Having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three cycles, she feels empowered and sure that she can provide decent daily food for her kids and improve her lifestyle in a gradual manner. Now, she is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes that she can refill her grocery stock on time and make more income for her family’s sake.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela de 38 años de edad ,es divorciada y posee una vivienda a base de madera donde comparte sus dias con sus tres hijos.Posee unas parcelas que adquirió con el apoyo de su ex esposo y poco a poco logro trabajarla hasta convertirlo en el principal sustento familiar.
Comenzó de a pocos pero luego logro contratar trabajadores del lugar para agilizar las diversas tareas productivas con la finalidad de obtener cacao orgánico de calidad cuyas plantaciones ocupan el área total de sus parcelas.Lleva un promedio de 15 años de trabajo y el precio del cacao a tenido pequeños incrementos.espera adquirir más parcelas de cultivo para ampliar sus plantaciones y en efecto incrementar sus ingresos económicos en beneficio de sus hijos a quienes espera apoyar hasta convertirlos en buenos profesionales.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir de manera responsable con el pago de sus cuotas .Con los 3,000 nuevos soles otorgados contratará trabajadores del lugar para quitar la maleza de sus parcelas y obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Graciela is 38 years old, divorced, and possesses a home made of wood where she spends her days with her 3 children. Graciela owns some parcels of land she acquired with the help of her ex-husband and, little by little, she has managed to work it until it was converted into the principal source of her family's sustenance.

Graciela began with little but, eventually, she managed to hire local laborers to lighten the diverse production tasks and in the end, she has obtained quality organic chocolate whose plantings occupy all of her parcels. It took 15 years of work and the price of chocolate has grown only in small increments. 

Graciela hopes to acquire more parcels to farm in order to expand her plantings and, in effect, to increase her income and benefit her children, whom she hopes to assist in becoming good professionals.

This is Graciela's 1st loan with Kiva, and she is very grateful for the opportunity offered. She promises to comply with her schedule of payments in a responsible way. With the 3,000 sols requested, Graciela will contract local laborers to pull the weeds on her parcels in order to obtain a good harvest.

loans.use: to hire local laborers to work on her organic chocolate farm.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, se dedica a la agricultura; vive con su familia, sus padres y hermanos, está soltero y no tiene hijos. Víctor aprendió el oficio de sus padres, quienes siempre se han dedicado a lo mismo, no tiene horario establecido porque este lo lleva a cabo en terreno propio.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas, herbicidas, pesticidas, entre otros; esto le ayudara a tener lo necesario para trabajar en el cultivo. 
Su objetivo es tener casa propia, formar su familia y obtener favorables cosechas.
texts.en:
Víctor works in agriculture; he lives with his family, parents and siblings.  He’s single and has no children.  Víctor learned his parents’ occupation; they’ve always done the same thing.  He has no set work schedule because he works in his own fields.

The loan he needs will make it possible for him to buy farm supplies like manure, insecticide, herbicide, and fungicide, among others that will help him have what’s needed to work in his crops.  His objective is to have his own house, to form a family and get good crop yields.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Danilo Edilberto

texts.es:
Danilo tiene 29 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo vive con su mama en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.

Es integrante de ventanilla V.R.C.  Virgen de Guadalupe que se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Puerto  Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica  a  labores agropecuarias.

Danilo se dedica a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de gallinas. 

 Solicita el préstamo para  poder comprar los fertilizantes para la siembra y para arrendar  terrenos. 

 Las compras lo realiza en el cantón ventanas.   

Su sueño es mejorar su cultivo y la producción para tener una mejor calidad de  vida.


 El desafío  que enfrenta es combatir contra la naturaleza. 


 En su tiempo libre la gusta criar animales y cuidar al hermano.
texts.en:
Danilo, 29, is single and has a son; he lives with his mother in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “Virgen de Guadalupe” communal bank located in Puerto Pechinche Canton belonging to Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This communal bank works in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Danilo works growing corn and raising chickens.  He’s requesting the loan to be able to buy fertilizer for the crops and to pay land rental fees.  His purchases take place in Ventanas Canton.  His dream is to improve his crops and crop yields to have a better quality of life.  The challenge he faces is battling nature.  He enjoys raising animals and caring for his brother in his free time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay land rental fees.

loans.name: Santos Victorino

texts.es: don santos de 53 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maiz, y frijol vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 21, 23 y 26 años, es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos con las ganacias que obtiene de las ventas de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Santos esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar: abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas asi como muestra la fotografia y herramientas para su cultivo de maiz y frijol y asi poderle dar a su famila una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos, 53, works growing corn and beans; he lives with his wife and three children who are 21, 23, and 26 years of age.  He’s a hardworking man who is very responsible with his household obligations since he’s always been noted for providing the best for his children with profits obtained from selling his crops; he’s able thus to cover household expenses. 

Santos is asking for a loan to be able to buy manure, fertilizer and pesticides like shown in the photo and tools for his corn and bean crops to provide better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 53-year-old vigorous lady, and has been sewing clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors, packs of lace, zippers and buttons in order to increase her revenue and generate a strong source of income. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Sovann's Group

texts.en: Sovann, a 42-year-old mother of two kids, is a local farmer from Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. Besides this agricultural business, she also tailors clothes while her husband works at construction sites for extra income. Sovan has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She is part of  a group of first microloan borrowers to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can make more income in order to continually sustain her living standards.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Zoila Aracely

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 21 años de edad es soltera tiene 2 hijos vive con el papa y sus hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia los Ríos.

Es integrante de ventanilla V.R.C.  Virgen de Guadalupe que se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Puerto  Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica  a  labores agropecuarias.

Zoila se dedica a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de gallinas.

 Solicita el crédito  para arriendo de terreno para la siembra  y compra de insumos. 

 Las compras lo realizan en el Cantón Ventanas Frecuentemente en agripag. 

Su sueño es mejorar la producción de los cultivos.

 El desafío que enfrenta es combatir con la plaga de la cinta roja.

 En su tiempo libre le gusta vender ropa por catalogo y reunirse con los amigos.
texts.en:
Zoila, 21, is single and has two children; she lives with the father and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Virgen de Guadalupe” communal bank located in Puerto Pechinche Canton belonging to Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This communal bank works in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Zoila works growing corn and raising chickens.  She’s requesting the loan to be able to buy supplies for the crops and to pay land rental fees.  Her purchases take place in Ventanas Canton, often at Agripac.  Her dream is to improve her crops.  The challenge she faces is battling the ‘cinta roja’ [a fungal plague] infestation.  In her free time she enjoys selling clothes via catalog and getting together with her friends.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay land rental fees.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
Elena  tiene 36 años de edad es soltera vive con la familia en el Cantón  Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.

Es integrante de ventanilla V.R.C.  Virgen de Guadalupe que se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Puerto  Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica  a  labores agropecuarias.

Elena se dedica a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de gallinas. 

Solicita el crédito para el arriendo de terreno para la siembra.

 Las compras se realiza en el  Cantón Ventanas en el  Comercial Laura García. 

Su sueño es comprar terreno para el cultivo para no arrendar.

 El desafío que enfrenta es  el trabajo contra la maleza.

 En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a criar animales.
texts.en:
Elena, 36, is single living with her family in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Virgen de Guadalupe” communal bank located in Puerto Pechinche Canton belonging to Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This communal bank works in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Elena works growing corn and raising chickens.  She’s requesting the loan to be able to pay land rental fees.  Her purchases take place in Ventanas Canton, at Laura García Market.  Her dream is to purchase farmland and no longer lease it.  The challenge she faces is battling weeds.  In her free time she enjoys raising animals.

loans.use: to pay land leasing fees.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios lives in Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol with her family. She and her husband are engaged in fishing for 15 years now. Together, they work hard to support the needs of their family. She has 7 children ages 4-22. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fishing nets, crab traps and floaters.  Her children motivate her to work hard. She hopes that someday, she will be able to see them finish college and have a good life.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, crab traps and floaters

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Roeun is 43 years old and a married mother of five children. She is a peasant who does rice farming, peanut planting, and corn growing in order to deal with the daily basic needs of the family. Her 20 years involvement in the current business has returned her about 37,000 KHR per day. This is the first time for Roeun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is seeking for 2,000,000 KHR in order to lease an additional plot of farmland for growing more corn. She hopes to gain a high yield from her various businesses and make a good profit for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to lease an additional plot of farmland to grow more corn

loans.name: Petronilo

texts.en: Petronilo is a 43-year-old farmer from the town of Alicia, Bohol. He is also engaged in transporting passengers using his motorcycle. For ten years now, his farming business has provided food and income for his family. He is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy seedlings, fertilizer and insecticide for his farm so he can continue his business and for his crops to thrive. In the future, he hopes to have a bigger land to cultivate to maximize his profit.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is a 36-year-old farmer and a habal-habal (motorcycle with an extended seat used to transport passengers in the remote areas) driver. He lives in Ubay with his family. He has a five-year-old daughter to support out of his income.  

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for his farm and a spare tire for his motorcycle so he can continue to sustain his businesses. The income will provide food and school fees this coming school year for his daughter. In the future, he hopes to live an abundant life from his business success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a spare tire for his businesses

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen resides in Ubay, Bohol with her family. She is 34 years old, married, with three children ages 4, 12 and 15. Her husband works as a bus conductor.
